I've had it over a month, have taken hundreds of shots, spent a substantial amount of time with the manuals, and still haven't dived into all of the functions. What I have used works superbly! The menus and controls are solid (once you learn the conventions - which is a fairly simple task) and access to the functions seems easy. I guess it would't hurt to mention that it takes excellent pictures. You get a choice of the RAW format or several qualities of JPEG or both at the same time. Several reviews mentioned it was a good starter camera for those moving from other sorts of cameras to a DSLR, but I feel certain it will take me quite some time to grow out of this one.

Reviews.Title: Easy to use!!
Reviews.Author: Lois Standridge "eager reader"
Reviews.Content: I have been thinking about getting a "better" camera for a while to take basketball pictures.  I am very pleased with my purchase.  Wish i hadn't waited so long

Reviews.Title: Amazing Camera! - Better than the Canon 20d
Reviews.Author: Nathan
Reviews.Content: Before I buy a product I always check the reviews to see what other owners of the product have seen with the product. Before I bought the camera I did a lot of research and read a lot of reviews. All of the reviews were 5 stars and I was impressed with what I saw through the reviews, so I ordered it. When I received it, I was so impressed with it, I have never worked with a better camera. I am in video production, and the video on this camera is amazing. Wonderful camera! If you are reading this before you buy one, this is way better than the Canon 20d. This a great deal! Go ahead and get it! I love the camera. Thank you for reading.Nathan Johnson[...]

Reviews.Title: Great Camera - Great Price!
Reviews.Author: oneone7one5
Reviews.Content: This is my 1st DSLR or SLR of any kind for that matter so I am in no way an expert. The camera is easy to use and takes AMAZING pictures. I have taken more pictures in the last month than I have for the past 2 years. :) Very fun to try out the different settings and see the resulting great pictures. Even on full auto with auto focus on, the pictures are always perfect and so much more detailed and professional looking than any other camera I've ever owned. I would recommend this camera for anyone that wants to actually take GREAT pictures intead of just ok ones!

Reviews.Title: Lots of features, great video
Reviews.Author: Adam Schindler
Reviews.Content: I've had this camera for about a month, so it's a little early to make a definite assessment. But so far I really enjoy it. It has a lot of features that I'm still learning. The auto mode is typically pretty good for most photos, but you'll have to play with the settings on "Creative Auto" for best pictures under low light. The video quality is very good, though again don't trust the auto settings and determine the best lighting conditions for yourself. I haven't played with the software a lot but it seems pretty powerful to edit photos.

Reviews.Title: Excellent entry level DSLR
Reviews.Author: beaufam
Reviews.Content: I decided to buy this camera after reading reviews here and on other sites.To paraphrase most reviews said the camera is a basic no frills package that takes great pics and allows a beginner to expand there skills beyond point and shoot. I can't agree more the pics are excellent right out of the box in Auto Mode.Our daughter moved from shooting in Auto Mode to Basic Photo Mode within minutes and the pics are excellent. The instruction manual is pretty good to get started, but she plans on taking a local SLR course to move on to the next level of shootingAll in all a great SLR for the money, As a matter of fact I'm so impressed I plan on buying one for myselfMB

Reviews.Title: Excited
Reviews.Author: cathalina
Reviews.Content: The quality of the pictures, the light weight of the camera, how comfortable it is to take it to a trip, at my last trip the battery last 3 days taking many many shots for day and also using flash,  i'm very happy with it.

Reviews.Title: Awesome camera
Reviews.Author: Daycare mommy
Reviews.Content: We had lost our regular digital camera and wanted to upgrade to something a little more nicer to hopefully get some more decent pics of our daughters.  this camera is awesome.  Almost every picture i take of the girls turns out great compared to other cameras.  Because our kids are always moving it is near impossible to get a picture that is not blury and this camera can provide.  I have had tons of family and friends comment on how photogenic my kids are since we had this camera (no one said that before because it was near impossible to get a good one).  Well worth the money.  I am not tech savy at all but my husband is.  he loves to fiddle around and do all the tricky stuff and has a blast.  I personally am "old school" and like to click and shoot and this satisfies us both.  i would definatly recommend.  the clarity is great and for the money you cant go wrong.

Reviews.Title: Great camera; easy use
Reviews.Author: NMcNeil
Reviews.Content: This camera takes great pictures even if your not very familiar with photography. You can take great photos just set on auto. There are lots of options for more skilled photographers. I can't wait to learn more.As for price, Amazon has the best price I've seen lately.

Reviews.Title: Very nice camera!
Reviews.Author: P. Valenzuela
Reviews.Content: I bought this for my 13 year old daughter as her first "real" camera.  I have a more high end albeit older Canon camera.  I am amazed at the quality of the pictures this camera takes! Better than mine! It is user friendly and, of course, the lenses can be inter changed with other Canon lenses when she gets up to spped on usage. After doing some research, I determined that Amazon had the best price around  Overall, I am very happy with this purchase!

Reviews.Title: I LOVE THIS CAMERA
Reviews.Author: jessica
Reviews.Content: This camera is great for beginners like me! all the pictures came out very clear. The only problem are the lens. the ones that come with it sometimes doesnt focus well. so i suggest that you should buy better lens

Reviews.Title: Easy to use
Reviews.Author: Danielle
Reviews.Content: After searching for a good easy to use camera and reading all other reviews, this one is exactly what I was looking for. I am not a professional photographer, I use it for special family functions and to take pictures of my infant, its easy point shoot is so much fun and worth it! I enjoy trying all the fuctions, easy to read manual, gives plenty of pointers for those who are not professionals.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera but Need to Learn How to Use it
Reviews.Author: Corina T.
Reviews.Content: I got this camera as a birthday gift for my husband. He really wanted a semi professional camera and this one seemed the best. It is definitely a great camera. It has a ton of features, the lens is impeccable and it allows you take very detailed pictures. You can make the background or foreground blurry and add filters and play with the light. I have to say though, that it takes a lot of playing around with it. It's not like a regular point and shoot. You need to learn the features in order to take some nice shots. If you have an editing program such as photoshop you can really have some fantastic results.

Reviews.Title: Digital Camera
Reviews.Author: C. Hoyt "hawaiianpride"
Reviews.Content: Exactly what I wanted in a digital camera.  I absolutely love this camera. So much better then those little pocket cameras and worth the money.

Reviews.Title: Very good
Reviews.Author: Mr. Chandra Kilarusatish
Reviews.Content: My brother has this. He takes very very nice photos. Especially the photos of jumping kids... they look like the time froze when the photos were taken. I am impressed.

Reviews.Title: Has a very soft focus.
Reviews.Author: Artworks Images Photography
Reviews.Content: I'm a professional photographer so I'm a little more picky about my photos then the average person but I don't think I'm unreasonable when it comes to wanting a sharp image.  Most people wouldn't ever notice their images slightly blurred but I know some do.  I replaced my XTi with the T3 after it got stolen after 8 years of wonderful use.  This was for my personal use, not professional so I wasn't looking for anything that delivered like a Canon 5d would.  Let me say that the price is great for this camera.  You can't beat that but after using this camera, it is definitely not worth any more then the $300 I paid for it.The cons:The body has a very cheap feeling to it that I have never felt in a canon camera before (I used to work at a camera store a few years back).  It feels almost like one of those disposable cameras you used to be able to get.  Like not $300 cheap, more like $80 cheap!I have had VERY few sharp images with this camera.  I'm a professional photographer so I know what I'm doing it taking a sharp image.  I used my 17-55mm and my 24-70mm lenses and neither could produce decent results.  These lenses are worth $1000 and $2000 so if anything could get a great image from this camera, they should.  And I'm trying not to be overly picky here but they were very soft images.Pros:Light weightpricecan shoot at much higher ISOs then my XTi.  Its amazing the difference in this little camera.  I can shoot at 3200 without any noticeable noise in a properly exposed photo.  This is far superior to my old XTi.  I had no idea the lower end cameras were advanced enough to do that.  But I would assume that any camera above this (60D, T3i) would be able to deliver this as well.The camera seems to communicate better with my external flash.  I've been getting much better exposure while using my external flash in low light situations.  Once again, I'm sure any model above this would do likewise.As a sum up, if you don't notice the soft focus and don't mind the cheap feeling, go for it.  If you're concerned with those factors, check out the T3i.  Its only $200 more and has a swivel screen.  I'll be checking it out myself to see if the focus is better.

Reviews.Title: Still learning how to use it...
Reviews.Author: Heather
Reviews.Content: ... but I LOVE it so far! I had always been happy with the quality of my iPhone photos (I haven't used my Canon point & shoot in years) until I bought this. I take a photo of the same subject with each, and the difference in quality is amazing.The only complaint I have (and it doesn't even bother me enough to reduce my rating) is that the shutter is slower when I have the display screen on. I use this mainly for food photography, so if I'm taking a picture of a cake it's no big deal. But if I'm photographing a moving, breathing subject I turn the screen off and use the viewfinder.

Reviews.Title: Beginner Photographer? Get a 1100D instead of a 5D MKIII!!!
Reviews.Author: Photonamic
Reviews.Content: A few years back, I had decided to sell my Sony Cybershot DSC-HX1 as I felt somewhat limited due to it not having interchangeable lenses. After about 2 years without a camera, I had decided that I wanted to get back into the world of photography - that's when I had purchased the Canon EOS Rebel T3/1100D and its 18-55mm kit lens.Prior to getting the 1100D, I hadn't even considered myself a photographer - but soon I found myself on a journey to learning how to operate the camera in manual, aperture priority and shutter priority. After indulging myself with knowledge in photography, I became a better photographer - and was able to take beautiful pictures using the 1100D. The kit lens is also a great little lens. It is adjustable from 18-55mm and delivers quite sharp images with very little chromatic aberration.The 1100D's menu is quite easy to learn and as you become more knowledgeable in photography - you can adjust the settings to your liking.Just a tip, if you are thinking about getting into photography, don't go for a top of the line camera thinking that by throwing it in automatic, you will get amazing pictures that you can sell for thousands of dollars. Cameras are only tools used to capture an image, and its the skill and creativity of its owner whom makes an amazing photograph.Pros of the T3/1100D:The 1100D does not weigh much and isn't as bulky as the other EOS cameras. Great beginner's camera for the price. Can shoot in RAW and JPEG simultaneously. ISO up to 6400. Comes with a EF-S 18-55mm kit lens which is a great little lens (I'm selling my T3, but keeping the lens!).Cons of the T3/1100D:Battery compartment/memory card combo. I did not mind this until I really started getting into photography. I had decided to purchase a battery grip (which you have the choice of buying a $70 canon grip that is no longer in production, or a generic plastic grip), and if I ever had to change out a SDHC card, I'd had to take off the grip just to do so. The button scheme for making adjustments to the settings is hard to get used to (I usually press "Q" and then scroll through the options that I want to change - this takes time and gets in the way of getting a great shot).I give this camera a 4/5 for getting me to where I am now!

Reviews.Title: Still can't believe how awesome this camera is!
Reviews.Author: tcgonda
Reviews.Content: Seriously, this is the best deal! I priced this same camera, same specs, with Target, Walmart, BestBuy, Canon's website, Sears...etc. Buying through Amazon (Prime) probably saved me over $150.00.I have now had this for over 6 months. I have had NO issues. The quality of the pictures are pristine! This makes photography fun!Its good for beginners. Its good for veterans. You can't go wrong, and its easy to use!

Reviews.Title: Canon EOS Rebel T3 12.2 MP CMOS Digital SLR with 18-55mm IS II Lens
Reviews.Author: John Hollenbach "Jack"
Reviews.Content: I was an amature photographer back in the day with a 35 SLR, when the market went digital I decided to just get a pocket camers (Canon Power Shot). This lasted for a few years until recently when I started taking pictures while hiking - took the plunge and got this camera, and will not go back. The quality of pictures is wonderful, easy to use and understand. Regret not doing this earlier.

Reviews.Title: Love it!
Reviews.Author: debbie
Reviews.Content: Excellent. Easy to use ! Love it ! My friends and family want to buy this camera. It takes great pictures!

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Jamie Cunningham
Reviews.Content: Great deal for a good camera.  Perfect entry level SLR camera, takes great pictures.  Much better than our point and shoot.

Reviews.Title: Good for the price
Reviews.Author: Ahmed
Reviews.Content: This can be the best camera if you are entering the DSLR level of cameras. Its good for new people and has a lot of features.

Reviews.Title: amazing camera for the price !
Reviews.Author: windy
Reviews.Content: I'm in love with this camera, my brother spent more than 2000 $ on his camera and filter and you can't tell his pictures from the one I take with this canon

Reviews.Title: I like it
Reviews.Author: salma alfaisal
Reviews.Content: I have already used it. I like it so much because it met my needs.  Thank you and I appreciate it

Reviews.Title: Sweet camera
Reviews.Author: Dan
Reviews.Content: Got this for my wife for Christmas and she loved it.  A great camera packed with cool features, we just need to figure out how to use them all.

Reviews.Title: Amazing quality, easy to learn to use
Reviews.Author: Jennifer
Reviews.Content: I finally retired my Canon EOS 700 film camera and replaced it with this. I've used a few digital cameras but nothing high quality. This camera brings home the best pictures and has such a vast upgrade capability. Well worth the pricepoint!

Reviews.Title: I just had to replace the one I had previously that I dropped...
Reviews.Author: Tamara D. Neilson "tluvsjewelry"
Reviews.Content: Can't beat the price on this and you can't beat or even try to come close to the picture quality with other cameras. Due note I'm an amateur. I love the auto focus..always a great shot with Canon. I tried a few other cameras in between ..a bit cheaper but nothing compared to my Canon. NOTHING. I do feel the 12MP is as good as the 18. Unless you are going to blow it up poster size, really...not much of a difference. In fact some say the 18MP is a tad more grainy. I don't know if that's true or not but I can attest for the 12MP being fantastic. I had one prior from 3 years ago..I dropped it and it hit the ground hard enough to break - pretty costly to fix it as it wasn't just the lens so it made better sense to get a new one. Be careful with them...once you have one, you won't want to have anything less.

Reviews.Title: Amazing quality
Reviews.Author: Rachel Hajducko
Reviews.Content: I took this camera with me to Florida and took pictures all over of scenery and wildlife, it took amazing pictures up close and far away. It doesn't seem to handle indoor action photography very well but amazing for stills. Also has a hard time focusing on neutral colors or similar colored things, such as a white or black cat.

Reviews.Title: It was awesome!
Reviews.Author: David Osorio
Reviews.Content: Buy it if your'e looking forward enter into the world of photography. An excelent camera! It'll do the work, for sure.

Reviews.Title: A great camera for a beginner or as a second camera
Reviews.Author: Mike
Reviews.Content: With the amount of lenses Canon has available for the Rebel Series you can get a lot of bang for your buck.  This camera is capable of taking great pictures without breaking the bank.  Certain lenses will work on Canons full frame cameras too while others will not.  i would recommend purchasing better glass before a better camera.  If you feel you might ever upgrade to a full frame, keep that in mind when selecting lenses.  People will chirp in your ear telling you what you should spend your money on.  For most people this will be more than suffice to feed your photography hunger.  They hold their value pretty well too.

Reviews.Title: Camera takes great pictures but died after 2 years of infrequent use
Reviews.Author: momitch
Reviews.Content: This camera was great but died after 2 years of minimal usage. This camera was $500 when I bought it, and I think for that price an item should last longer than 2 years. The cameras memory became corrupted and Canon said they would fix it for $200. Not much less than buying the camera body new. I still have my 1st Canon 35 millimeter from the 70's and it works great. It's too bad that things are not made to last anymore. I may switch to Nikon.

Reviews.Title: All the camera I need
Reviews.Author: SUDS "SS"
Reviews.Content: I have been using this camera for about a year. I have taken some great pictures and some not so great pictures. I am a hobby photographer who purchased a nice camera to take pictures of my kids. I have gotten some great shots of my kids. I don't have the time to study up and take the best pictures so I attribute a lot of my success to luck and a nice camera. If you are like me and you are looking for a nice camera but most likely you will not have the time to become a photography expert, then this is probably a good camera for you. I don't think that my talents will ever exceed the limits of this camera.

Reviews.Title: great for first DSLR
Reviews.Author: Teresa Baugh
Reviews.Content: gave this to my daughter for Christmas.  She has been wanting one for years.  She LOVES it and thanks me everyday :)

Reviews.Title: Incredible Camera
Reviews.Author: Randy
Reviews.Content: I was a Nikon loyalist for years until purchasing this camera. I have yet to find a single flaw in it. This camera made me switch from film within a week. Easy to learn and contains endless features. Perfect camera for budding professionals or casual enthusiasts looking for a more than capable piece of equipment.

Reviews.Title: Very Good Camera!
Reviews.Author: Michael Mandell
Reviews.Content: I bought this from Walmart for Christmas and its really awesome. Great range of capabilities, very crisp, quick, amazing for taking action shots, casual photos of the family, portraits, or still life photos, with additional lenses can take macro, wide angle...etc.. for a great price.The only glitch with the Canon EOS Rebel is the san disk still wants to only partially complete its cycle when downloading and renders the photos on the disk unreadable. Make sure you back up your disk on the computer. You risk losing them otherwise. Verdict: awesome camera, great for the money. downloadable SD feature, still a little behind the times

Reviews.Title: Perfect Christmas gift for my daughter!
Reviews.Author: susan bradley
Reviews.Content: This is a great camera that takes excellent photo's. This camera will be something she will be able to enjoy for years to come. She's since received various lenses for it and they have added to the enjoyment.

Reviews.Title: Great!!!
Reviews.Author: kay
Reviews.Content: Absolutely awesome! My pets are thoroughly annoyed with being my test subjects but any questions I had were solved easily by just searching google since this is a popular camera there are lots of how tos out there. I had the old rebel t2 and can't be happier with the upgrade! It is a smidge to the heavy side but I have small hands and slim arms. The plastic doesn't feel too cheap and after working the dials a few times they weren't as stiff as they were out of the box. I did not go for the t3i because I like the old fashioned view finder better than the digital display for most shots. The start up is pretty darn quick and the shutter is quiet, great for animals. For beginners I suggest reading though the basics on digital photography schools website (tons of free articles) while you wait for your camera to arrive, it made my new fancy camera seem much less complex.

Reviews.Title: Nice buy for the price
Reviews.Author: WinstonUser
Reviews.Content: Good pictures during night as well. Excellent clarity for all pictures. Modes work effectively.One minor comment: Sometimes focusing when the camera is moving or during travel becomes difficult. In short if object is moving, picture can be taken easily. However, if camera is moving, it takes time to focus.Battery Life is excellent and lasts long. Haven't seen the battery drain out so far even when used extensively throughout the day. Using the camera for the last one month

Reviews.Title: Michael Kephart
Reviews.Author: Michael Kephart
Reviews.Content: I thought it was a great deal and combining the extra lens by with the sd card and case buy was genius in sales tactics. This deal out beat all the other deals I could find for black Friday. For 439.99 and some tax.

Reviews.Title: Good Camera
Reviews.Author: Laura Morgan
Reviews.Content: A great camera for the price. Also have the T3i and would recommend that one first. It has a few additional features that are worth the money.

Reviews.Title: One of the Best SLR camera for starters
Reviews.Author: GKT
Reviews.Content: I simply love this camera. I just fell in love with this camera. Its the most simple camera for any aspiring photographer. It has very simple interface which is very easy to use with a little bit exploring. it takes some unbelievable shots with AUTO mode. However I would recommend you use manual modes for some nice photographs. Its very easy to learn to operate this camera. Its very well built. Body is made of plastic, however it doesnt look cheap. Its very sturdy. Shutter speed is really fast even at this low price. I would recommend using tripod for all night time photography. I have been very proud owning it even after over an year. I would recommend it to anyone who wants to start photography as hobby or profession. Its a very nice entry level SLR Camera.

Reviews.Title: Love it!
Reviews.Author: Tammy Rosser
Reviews.Content: Love is camera. Great pictures. Not real heavy. Learning about manual settings and having fun getting great shots! Good starter camera and a good price.

Reviews.Title: I love my camera
Reviews.Author: JBen
Reviews.Content: I LOVE almost everything about this camera.  The only complaint is that sometimes I would prefer that it snap pictures faster on the regular settings, but most times that is not a problem.  It does move fast if you are set on the action setting which is good.  I have pictures from many beautiful places on this camera and they almost always turn out perfect.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Richard C.
Reviews.Content: Love the camera. Need to add a telephoto lens and a wide angle lens. But the camera itself works great, takes nice clear photos.

Reviews.Title: Awesome, awesome camera
Reviews.Author: Charles Glenn
Reviews.Content: By far one of the best investments we've ever made.  This is our first DSLR camera; prior to this we had the quick pocket-type digital cameras.  This camera is very fast (memory card plays a part in this; we have Class 10) and shoots great pictures and video.

Reviews.Title: Right camera, right features, right price
Reviews.Author: L. Brannel
Reviews.Content: Easy to use in 'point and shoot' mode or but also provides creative options.  As much camera as I need--more complicated options and a higher price would be a waste for me.  As an artist I want to focus on my own work, not become a pro photographer. I need to take pictures for reference to paint later, take candid shots at openings for use in publicity and blogs, document my work for inventory purposes and have high quality images for submission to shows and galleries.  This camera fills the bill!

Reviews.Title: Canon EOS Rebel T3 12.2 MP CMOS Digital SLR with 18-55mm IS II Lens and EOS...
Reviews.Author: Dolby Dubrow "Dolby Dubrow"
Reviews.Content: Great camera, love the ease of this slr not to big, fits just right in my small hand..A no brainer camera if you are looking for something that is NOT complicated....

Reviews.Title: Amazing instrument for the price.
Reviews.Author: Tinkerer36
Reviews.Content: This camera has more buttons than my computer and is just as difficult to learn to operate.  The users manual takes two days to read but it tells almost everything needed to operate the camera.  There are still a few functions I don't know how to operate but, I'm learning and it's lots of fun.

Reviews.Title: Great camera for the price
Reviews.Author: Preston Merkel "Preston Merkel"
Reviews.Content: I have had this camera for a few months now, I got it back in May because my other point and shoot broke and I was looking to upgrade to something a little more professional. For the price, this is the best camera I have owned, Ive always wanted to be a photographer and I'm pleased to have this camera because my pictures are really crisp and clear, the lens it comes with is great.I recently just bought a different lens to use with it (50mm f/1.8) so i could have a blurry background and it has been amazing.It has great battery life and comes with everything you need to start out with. I recommend this to any new entry level photographer.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera at Any Price... But, Especially This Price
Reviews.Author: Jules Verne "Captain Nemo"
Reviews.Content: This is a great camera.  For the price of a Point and Shoot, you have a D-SLR that takes awesome photographs.  A novice can use it right out of the box, a professional could easily use it as a backup camera in the field.  I bought this to document the grandchildren, had it shipped to my daughter's home right before baby came.  Took 250 shots in 4 days... outstanding.  From turning "on" to "shoot" is almost instantaneous when grabbing the antics of a toddler in action before the opportunity is lost.  Truly amazing on close-ups of new-born's face in low-light conditions, as well.  I am very pleased and satisfied with this purchase in spite of some of the more negative comments.

Reviews.Title: Best deal for the price!
Reviews.Author: Orange Illusions "Orangey"
Reviews.Content: I do stop motion animation but I also like taking pictures. This isn't a pro camera but it comes pretty darn close sometimes! The images are really good. I always use the manual setting because I'm a control freak and don't like my camera to think for me. It's nice and light. I've used it for everything from family snapshots to somewhat artistic photos to animation. Right now it's attached to a tripod looking at a light box for paint on glass animating and it does a perfect job.

Reviews.Title: LOVE
Reviews.Author: Holly
Reviews.Content: This is the best camera I've ever owned, and currently own. I'm a year behind in reviewing this and it's still the best camera I've ever used.

Reviews.Title: Canon, never disappointed
Reviews.Author: TK
Reviews.Content: I really enjoy all my cameras by Canon so far, and this one is no exception. It performs flawlessly! I really recommend it for starting DSLR photography. 2lbs, not too heavy at all. I am going to use this for my upcoming overseas trip and I cannot wait!

Reviews.Title: LOVE IT
Reviews.Author: Fatima
Reviews.Content: Such an easy purchase process. The camera itself is great. With absolutely no photgraphy background or knowledge you can take great almost professional photos once you get familiar with the basics. Great start off camera for anyone wanting to develop their photography skills.

Reviews.Title: Canon
Reviews.Author: Squeaky
Reviews.Content: Actually, this camera was purchased for a family member, but he assures me he is very happy with the product and equally happy with Amazon. We are Canon people in my family. Never been disappointed.

Reviews.Title: daughter loves it!
Reviews.Author: Randy Lee
Reviews.Content: Bought it for my 12 year old daughter for her birthday. It was a total surprise and she loves it! Enough said.

Reviews.Title: Perfect for 1st DSLR camera
Reviews.Author: kdavis1106
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera to take better quality photos of my twin daughters. It does a great job. There are many functions I still have yet to learn, but the auto mode does great for me as a beginner. I am excited to learn more. This camera is priced well and taking the leap was well worth it! If you are on the fence, this is a great camera that I love using.

Reviews.Title: Amazing Camera!
Reviews.Author: GNN Photography "GNN"
Reviews.Content: This review is for the Canon Rebel T3 with the 18-55mm lensLet me start by saying this is the best camera I have ever owned! It replaced a GE Point and Shoot, and a Canon Rebel XSI. I am an armature photographer who specializes in portrait and nature photography. The camera has always been on top of everything I shoot, and the images look stunning in post editing software. Not only does the quality of the images look stunning, but the camera body looks and feels amazing (even though most of the materials used is a durable plastic). This camera is very light, and is a dream during long photo shoots, or outings here in Oregon. Speaking of Oregon (where if you don't like the weather wait for 5 minutes) this camera has remained functional during some light rain. Even though this camera looks like its predecessor XSI, this camera exceeds in terms of shooting capabilities. Both the T3 and XSI have the same 12.2 megapixels and the same operating specs, but the T3 just seems more fluid while shooting. I will go in depth on what was just stated later on in the review. The review begins with the following:-UsabilityPro's: Feels good in hands, never slips out of hands, VERY light!Con's: Matte finish collects smudges, the possibility that this camera may not hold up in a fall (I have yet to find this out)-FunctionalityPro's: Fast shutter speed, stunning low light situations, crammed with megapixels, in camera editing, amazing colors (sunsets look real to life), highly customizablemenu options and settings.Con's: Occasionally the camera freezes OR is slow with processing images*T3 VS. XSI*The T3 as mentioned earlier is almost the same as the XSI but with some minor differences depending on the user. Getting back to the fluidness of the camera that can be traced back to the updated DIG!C processor. Images just seem to come out brighter and clearer (maybe its just me). The XSI however was made out of more metal and rubber which made the build quality better, but much heaver.SummaryIf you are someone who needs functionality and speed from a light weight camera than the T3 is for you. But if you want more megapixels than I would recommend the T3I. Either way the Canon brand has made some very functional friendly cameras, and cost efficient DSLR'S lately. If you are coming from a point and shoot make the jump you won't retreat it!

Reviews.Title: Cool DSLR.
Reviews.Author: Toecutter
Reviews.Content: This is my first DSLR, it's fun and easy to use. Read the manuel get comfortable with the camera and you'll love it.

Reviews.Title: Canon EOS Rebel T3 - Great DSLR Camera
Reviews.Author: JMM

battery life is very good.WHAT I DISLIKE:- Sometimes Autofocus does not always work properly, even though its very obvious what the subject should be (this only happens a small percentage of the time, and it's not a huge issue because manual focus is the way to go in my opinion).- I remember that I thought the camera was a bit noisy when you snap a photo - I've since gotten used to it.The one thing I would recommend is to invest in a telephoto lens, you will want to have it so you can zoom in on subjects that are farther away. Amazon often has discounts or offers if you purchase a telephoto lens with the camera. Here's a bundle, this seems to be the best deal currently (but Amazon's prices are always changing): Canon EOS Rebel T3 12.2 MP CMOS Digital SLR and 18-55mm IS II Lens and EF 75-300mm f/4-5.6 III Telephoto Zoom Lens Bundle

Reviews.Title: Excellent product and service.
Reviews.Author: ZeldaZucchini
Reviews.Content: I am very happy with the camera.  It arrived early and was just what was listed. I have a Canon AE1 that I've used for years so I expected the Rebel T3 to be a good choice and it was.  Everything is great!

Reviews.Title: Excellent camera for beginners!
Reviews.Author: Matthew LaClair
Reviews.Content: My wife and I decided to get this as she wanted to learn photography. This thing works great and is easy for her to use as a beginner. The photos come out beautifully just using the auto setting and it is easy to transfer everything over to a computer. The battery lasts for days and days so we only have to charge it every once in a while. We have been using this for roughly 3 months now and have yet to run into an issue. Great buy!

Reviews.Title: Great camera!! I love it!
Reviews.Author: Lindsay Malley
Reviews.Content: Great camera!! Amazing pictures and it has so much to offer. Can't wait to learn how to use it better and really use it to its full potential.

Reviews.Title: Canon EOS Rebel Camera
Reviews.Author: Pamela Smith
Reviews.Content: Love, Love, Love this camera!  It's easy to use and makes great pictures!  I use it professionally and for my own personal use!

Reviews.Title: Features and economy
Reviews.Author: William W. Volker
Reviews.Content: Light,comfortable to hold,pro features,and under $400.Have wasted too many years taking crappy photos with point and shoots.It's a nice camera.

Reviews.Title: Great product
Reviews.Author: andres
Reviews.Content: Great product, all the parts came perfectly packaged and in perfect status, The camera arrived in the time stablished and have no problems with it

Reviews.Title: Super value
Reviews.Author: Caveat Emptor
Reviews.Content: This is by far the best bang for the buck of any DSLR entry level.  Image quality is absolutely excellent, Without all the extra whistles and bells that you get in the much more expensive DSLR's costing $2-$10,000.  If you don't need a full frame DSLR this is the way to go; the APS – C sensor is wonderful.

Reviews.Title: My first foray into DSLR
Reviews.Author: Joseph F Dunn
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera at the recommendation of a friend who is a photographer.  I find this model to be very easy to use and am very, very happy with the quality and resolution of the pictures it takes.  So far, I haven't had any problems with it.  It is a little different than a standard point and shoot and that takes some getting used to (using the lens to zoom, taking the lens cover on and off).  This model also has more features than I will probably ever need.  Overall, it is a great buy in terms of quality vs. price.

Reviews.Title: Awesome camera!
Reviews.Author: Eric and Bethany Reinhold
Reviews.Content: The thing that is awesome about this camera is that it has so many great settings but even if you just use the auto setting, you get great pictures!

Reviews.Title: New customer
Reviews.Author: Sam
Reviews.Content: I have a hard time trusting online shopping and buying things from websites like this. I was very pleased when I received my camera just as it was described. Also arriving quicker than I thought!

Reviews.Title: Cannon Rebel T3
Reviews.Author: B. Miller
Reviews.Content: Purchased this camera as a Christmas gift for my 12 year old daughter who's interested in school photography.Takes great pictures, is easy to use and is light weight.Appears to be a great starter DSLR camera.

Reviews.Title: awesome camera
Reviews.Author: ulas
Reviews.Content: Love it.  Don't be fooled by some of the reviews, there is a learning curve to using this camera. Once you get through some tutorial videos on you tube, you can start playing with the camera. I realized that it is the photographer not the camera who can take beautiful pics. I took it on vacation with me. Even though I used the programmed functions, not the manual settings, the pics were much better than with my Sony Powershot. Good buy.

Reviews.Title: Canon Fan
Reviews.Author: CSP
Reviews.Content: I love my old Canon SLR so had a hard time making the decision to "go digital" - but feel like it was necessary in today's world.  This camera was offered at a great price and had good ratings.  I am so happy with my purchase.  Love the camera - and love that I have the option to do everything automatically or manually depending on situation.  I am also amazed at how much lighter this camera is than my old (but still awesome) Canon EOS Rebel SLR.  The digital is really convenient - and the photos quality is excellent.  I am a satisfied customer!

Reviews.Title: Amazing Price for an amazing camera
Reviews.Author: Benjamin Heilman "Ben Heilman"
Reviews.Content: Got the T3 and a zoom lens for $450 including shipping last month!  Came with a free backpack and memory card!The picture quality is amazing.  Upgraded from our point and shoot (which we loved) but it doesn't compare to the T3.  Thank you amazon for a great price on a super quality camera!

Reviews.Title: Love it!
Reviews.Author: Andrea
Reviews.Content: My husband got this for me as a birthday/christmas present. I really didn't want him spending a lot on something that we had no idea if it would be worth it but it totally is! I use it to take pictures of the kids almost every day to send to him in Afghanistan. It takes amazing shots with such clarity.

Reviews.Title: Great camera...perfect for DSLR starters!!!
Reviews.Author: Yazsar
Reviews.Content: I have bought this camera to shoot my 1 year old daughter. It's very hard to take perfect pictures in point and shoot while she is moving around. But with 50mm f1.8 lens(I have bought it separately), I am able shoot beautiful pictures and absolutely love this camera for the price that got. Also this is a very good for entry level dslr users who wants to get into photography world!!!

Reviews.Title: love my T3
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I love my new camera.  It is absolutely perfect for me. I have only had point and shoot cameras and was worried that the picture quality wouldn't be that different and not worth the price but I was wrong!

Reviews.Title: Great beginner camera!
Reviews.Author: aschoonover
Reviews.Content: Great camera, good for a beginner photographer...I would recommend it to any that wants to upgrade to a DSLR camera...

Reviews.Title: Great camera to start out with!
Reviews.Author: Chris Hoesly
Reviews.Content: As far as DSLR's go, this camera is a spectacular beginning camera to dive into great pictures without a lot of hassle. The basic "green box" setting is great for all forms of lighting and actions. As a novice, I learned a lot using this camera. The various exposure settings along with lenses make this awesome. By researching and attending classes, I've learned that this camera will support me for as long as I can imagine (or until I feel the need to upgrade).The added benefit that Canon provides interchangeable lenses regardless of when they were manufactured makes this even more appealing. I've enjoyed using this taking large family photos (requiring a 10 second delay), fireworks (manual setting), wakeboarding (action rapid shot) and everything in between.The only downside is that a new model always seems to come out. If you are ok with not having the latest and greatest, this camera has everything you could need starting out.

Reviews.Title: I love my camera!
Reviews.Author: i love my 8 children
Reviews.Content: It is so versatile, so light, and takes such great photos!  Get a good padded case to protect it.  It's worth the extra money.

Reviews.Title: Love this Canon Rebel EOS T3 Camera .....!!!
Reviews.Author: CR
Reviews.Content: Just really learning about DSLR camera's.......So far taking excellent photo's have been using manual mode to learn how the camera reacts to different scenes......There are so many features..So far Awesome...The main reason for purchasing the Canon Rebel EOS T3 over the Nikon D3100 which I also really liked too.......1. Very similar reviews on photo quality & Features.....Canon for me had easier menu operations and yes went to chain store to check them out........2. Was Amazons great price for the Canon and included with purchase free backpack & 16GB SD Card........and $150.00 Off extra lenses..So I puchased the 75-300mm Zoom lense for just a few dollars...This Canon Rebel EOS T3 with extras cost me less than the Nikon D3100...So Canon in my opinion really is trying to sell more cameras and lenses at affordable prices so more people can injoy the DSLR experience.......So purchasing from Canon and through Amazon is for my money the Winner.....!!!!

Reviews.Title: Easy to use, produces amazing photos
Reviews.Author: Genevieve H. Gutierrez
Reviews.Content: A small disclaimer - I'm not pro, but I've taken numerous photos in my personal life and career on many different cameras. Comparatively, this one is incredibly to use - the auto-focus is one of the most capable I've experience, thanks to the fact it picks out focus points - and pretty intuitive. I bought it 4 days before the trip-of-a-lifetime, and took one practice session at a professional event. Days later I used it without problem, and captured some amazing shots. It has its limitations, like any other camera, but I felt much more able with this camera that with others I've used.

Reviews.Title: Amazing Camera
Reviews.Author: David Olson
Reviews.Content: Beatiful pictures have taken both artistic and fun pictures. Works great for parties and simple fun shots and the photographer looking for a the perfect shot.

Reviews.Title: Canon camera of choice
Reviews.Author: Deborah GIchan "Deb Gichan"
Reviews.Content: I teach photography and purchased this camera for my daughter. It is also the model I use for my students. Excellent pre pro camera. Great price. Be sure to purchase 58 mm filter to protect lens and purchase memory card so that camera can be used right away.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Camera
Reviews.Author: Hatim Mallu
Reviews.Content: We bought this camera before our trip to 3 countries and used it immensely. The picture quality is brilliant. The feel of the camera is awesome. Haven't found any cons in this camera yet.

Reviews.Title: I absolutely love this camera!
Reviews.Author: cdrown
Reviews.Content: Very easy to use and the quality is amazing. Easy to play around with the settings to get the best shot. Great price for a fantastic product

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: J. Lansing-Eigenhuis
Reviews.Content: This is even better than the Rebel I had previously since it also takes video.  Being able to use a regular SD card makes it more convenient to download (no cable needed).

Reviews.Title: Great Starter DSLR
Reviews.Author: Gregory S Dalenberg
Reviews.Content: Until buying this camera I have only ever used point and shoot cameras and I have never taken any photography training. As my children became more active this proved too slow and often had lighting problems so I decided to upgrade and take a class on how to use it. I purchased the EOS Rebel T3 after reading the reviews and find that it is as easy to use the reviews indicate. I haven't started my class yet and I'm already taking much better pictures. It's so easy to change the setting that I'm playing around with them and quickly figuring which work best around the house.The few negative reviews I found talked about the camera being broken on receipt or soon thereafter. However, none of them mentioned anything about their experience with getting the camera repaired. In my case, the auto focus motor in the kit lens failed on the 3rd day I had the camera. I called and Canon and they very quickly got me the information to send the lens back. They repaired it under the warranty and I had it back in six business day from the day Canon received it. The lens has functioned properly since. No issues and no hassles.Bottom line: a great camera for the beginner and good customer service.

Reviews.Title: Love love love this camera!!!
Reviews.Author: Brooklyn
Reviews.Content: I love taking pictures but I'm no professional. I also didn't want to spend top dollar for a camera I may or may not be able to figure out. I was okay with a cheap digital camera but when the screen broke and I had a newborn baby which I just spent 200dollars to get newborn pic.'s done and wasn't even happy with them so instead I decided to go out and buy this camera. It was suprisingly easy to figure out all the different things this camera comes with. I will never go back to a cheap digital camera again.

Reviews.Title: Fast exposure
Reviews.Author: Bonnie Patterson
Reviews.Content: I love this camera. It's my 5th Canon camera I've had.  I like the speed of exposure. It's a bit heavy, but the functionality of it is great.  The only thing I don't like about it, is that in order to view your image in the pre-exposure screen, you have to press a button every time before hand.

Reviews.Title: excellent
Reviews.Author: AC
Reviews.Content: Love, Love, Love this camera. Easy for a beginners, more settings than I know what to do with and the video option is great for making video and picture slideshows. Pictures are of excellent quality and corrections are easy to make. Lots of options and accessories to keep it useful as your knowledge grows.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera.
Reviews.Author: Karl
Reviews.Content: Great choice when money is a factor, a middle ground choice, not settling for cheaper cameras but still having a digital SLR in your hands that is not too expensive but good enough to come up with awesome, professional, sharp, and beautiful pics! No regrets and endless time for endless amazing pics through this amazing camera! It will last for a very long time as you grow in your art and skills.

Reviews.Title: Cool Christmas Camera
Reviews.Author: Cynthia M. Nichols "Think Snow"
Reviews.Content: Can't wait to take pictures with our first SLR!  Waited to find the right one at a great price.  Not disappointed!

Reviews.Title: The Greatest
Reviews.Author: Deshawn
Reviews.Content: I been saving and waiting to have this camera in my hands I love the fact that this camera is easy to use. I am still learning just a little bit more but I got the hang of it. But, using the canon rebel t3 is very good and also lightroom 4 is the best editing for this camera i recommand that you purchase this camera I love it so much

Reviews.Title: Great Beginner Camera
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: As my first DSLR Camera, I don't think I could have made a better purchase.  Started taking pictures right out of the box using the automatic settings.  Let's you grow at your own pace while still enabeling you to take great pictures.  All the dials and buttons a little intimidating at first but once you learn your way around the camera it seems pretty user friendly.  Purchased Canon EOS Rebel T3/1100D For Dummies to go along with my learning experience.  Instruction booklet that came with the camera a little confusing and not very explanatory.

Reviews.Title: Good buy for Average Camera User
Reviews.Author: DoreenW
Reviews.Content: Hello All,I have always wanted a D-SLR Camera because I just thought they were so cool! I never really wanted to use all the features I just liked the ability to take great pictures, fast and easily. This camera does the job. I looked at the Nikon as well, but ultimately chose this one because of its ease of use. I've taken about 300 pictures so far and the battery has not yet died. The Nikon is a "better buy" for a experienced or a wanting to be experienced camera user. The main menu is far more confusion and accessories more expensive. But that is a personal decision. i wouldn't buy this camera if you're looking for something totally special, it is perfect for me.Cons: shutter sound sounds like a toy camera, kind of weird. lower megapixels than the equivalent NikonPros: EASY TO USE, EASY INTERACTIVE MENU TELLS YOU WHAT EACH OPTION ISGret Camera for the Buy

Reviews.Title: Awesome
Reviews.Author: Parker BRown
Reviews.Content: Amazing , i'm very happy i bought this. i defiantly think whoever is reading this should buy it.to see some cool photos taken with this camera goto [...]

Reviews.Title: WOW!
Reviews.Author: Mary Stewart Putney
Reviews.Content: What a GREAT camera - right out of the box it was easy to set up and start shooting fabulous pictures.  I spent 6 months researching different cameras until I finally found this one. Five stars definitely!

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Jan F.
Reviews.Content: I've only had this camera for a few months, but so far I've been very pleased with the quality of the pictures I've taken. The auto focus takes the guess work out of composing a picture.

Reviews.Title: Love it!
Reviews.Author: Melissa J. Grasis
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for my husband's birthday and it's been easy to use and the quality of the photos is great!

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: John
Reviews.Content: We love this camera.  Works great!  The pictures are crystal clear and so much better than our last camera.  The auto-focus feature works well too.  It is a good camera for both beginners and intermediate users.  Thanks.

Reviews.Title: LOVE IT!!!!!!!!!
Reviews.Author: A. Martens
Reviews.Content: So this is my first DSLR camera I've purchased and I have to say, I couldn't be more pleased with it!  I have several photographer friends and all have recommended Canon brand cameras. I can definitely see why, great pictures at an affordable price :) I purchased this camera from Best Buy with a bundle offer they had at that time. I ended up getting a telephoto lens in addition to the lens in the kit. Totally worth it! I use the telephoto lens more than the kit lens...I feel that the pictures look better with it. Such a great buy for someone just getting started in photography or upgrading from a point-and-shoot camera. Definitely recommend this camera...with the telephoto lens, of course.

Reviews.Title: Love my Canon Rebel!!!
Reviews.Author: CentralCoastGal "bcnelson5"
Reviews.Content: I spent weeks looking through Amazon to find a replacement for my point & shoot camera that finally quit working.  I looked specifically for a camera that was under $500 and had quality auto focus abilities, as I do not like to fiddle around with camera settings (because I usually screw them up), rapid fire picture taking so I don't have to wait while photographing the grandkids, superior picture quality, HD video setting, excellent battery life (a must), easy to upload to my computer and was overall reliable.I spent hours reading the comments about a number of cameras, (Canon, Nikon, Olympus, Panasonic) but kept coming back to this Canon EOS Rebel T3 because it met all of my above requirements whereas the other cameras for one reason or another (usually not good battery life or slow picture taking), did not.  As a side note, one person who bought this Canon through an Amazon vendor, was not happy with the package condition upon arrival at his home, and he had to return the damaged goods.  The day I decided to purchase this camera, it was actually $5 cheaper and on Prime through a vendor, however, I opted to pay the extra $5 and have it fulfilled and shipped by Amazon (whom I have never had a problem with packaging or customer service).  Package arrived is excellent condition BTW.Anyway, I LOVE this camera!!!!  For me, who is not a camera whiz, it does everything I want or need it to do.  The button functions are easily found, the pictures are superior and the lens fits just about every need I have.  However, I love this camera so much that I will probably spring for another zoom lens to experiment with more photography.  I also purchased the Transcend 16 GB SDHC smart card from Amazon and that works just fine. I will have to purchase another camera case as the lens is a little too big to fit into my modestly sized old point & shoot camera case.I am very glad I purchased this Canon EOS Rebel T3!

Reviews.Title: Love it
Reviews.Author: Jessica Kazigian
Reviews.Content: I recently bought this camera and love it! Easy to use, pictures are beautiful, and they print very well.  I have no complaints about this camera.

Reviews.Title: Canon Rebel T3
Reviews.Author: Timothy Kiser
Reviews.Content: Purchased this camera as a gift for my better half.  Price was the best I could find anywhere.  It arrived quickly.  Apparently it is easy to use (according to my wife).  Great intro to DSLR (?).  Plus it is a camera she can grow with as she improves.  Probably should have bit the bullet and purchased an extra lens but I didn't.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera!!
Reviews.Author: stevec
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera a few months ago to try to learn more about photography, more specifically how to use the different modes and settings.  This camera allows just that, it takes great pictures and isn't as intimidating to use as others.  The camera also isn't super heavy either which makes it pretty comfortable to carry around with the included neck strap.  I still use the kit lens that it comes with and it has served my purposes well, as a walking around lens.  I also love the fact that it comes with a rechargeable battery so that way you can take a ton of pictures per charge.If I had the opportunity I would buy this camera again, especially if you don't need all of the features of the new ones (particularly video).The only downside to this is that I felt that the lens was a little to plastic-y feeling and it took some getting used too, to adjust the focal length.

Reviews.Title: Excellent camera
Reviews.Author: Greg Taggesell
Reviews.Content: I needed a good camera for taking close up pictures of jewelry.  Anyone who has every photographed jewelry knows what a complete pain it is.  I had the right lighting system, and now I have the right camera to take the pictures.  The 55 MM lens is perfect for close up shots and being able to adjust the shutter speed, ISO and aperture were vital to the success of my jewelry photography.  I didn't know much about cameras until I bought this one, and I'm glad I did.  It was recommended to me from another jewelry photographer.  I recommend this camera to everyone!

Reviews.Title: Quality good
Reviews.Author: sooyo
Reviews.Content: Very is worth purchasing camera. Worth the money! Not very heavy, but to take the result is very good, and 600D is not much different from!

Reviews.Title: More then pleased with product.
Reviews.Author: KJoyner
Reviews.Content: I've only had to camera for about a month now but I love it. There's plenty of settings to play around with and the pictures come out so clear. It's not too heavy but light enough where you can carry it around with ease. I would recommend this camera to anyone out there. The controls are easy and self explanatory too.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Camera - Video Just Okay
Reviews.Author: Charlie Plumb
Reviews.Content: Camera is exactly as advertised.  One item on taking video.  It takes great video, but you basically have to use the manual focus while video-ing.  Not the easiest when chasing a toddler around, but it works.  I looked at other DSLR cameras that have continuous auto focus, but they tend to have a hard time figuring out what to focus on.  Basically after hours of research I realized you have to choose your poison on the video side for lower end DSLRs.  Either an auto focus that searches and is noisy or a manual focus which is only as good as the user :)We mainly bought this camera (upgrading from point and shoot) for pictures and for the price this camera takes amazing pictures.  Also the shutter lag is virtually zero which is another great thing when you have kids. The video is also pretty good once you get the hang of it.

Reviews.Title: Great Value for the New Photographer
Reviews.Author: Heather Rexon-Capewell "Living in a fantasy b...
Reviews.Content: My family had been looking to upgrade our point and shoot for sometime now, but we wanted an inexpensive learner. Ultimatly we found this camera to be just that one. The user guide is easy to follow, and it has multiple features that we found easy to use. The quality, for us, is astounding. While we may eventually upgrade the lens, it really has proven itself for macro shots as well as everyday photos.The camera body has the right amount of weight to it, and it fits nicely in my small hands, yet my husband had no problems with his larger hands. I have "children's hands" so this was a big selling point to me. Everything about the body is comfortable and there isn't any awkwardness.The only downfall is the software for editing. I really havn't quite figured it out yet, so until then I'll just use what I have.

Reviews.Title: Best Ever
Reviews.Author: gsm484
Reviews.Content: This is the best camera I have ever used. It takes great pictures and videos. It also comes with software that is very useful. I would recommend this camera to anybody that is just starting to use SLR cameras. The only thing is it is not quiet. It is quiet for normal times, but not for places that you must be extremely quiet. It is still a great camera with an unbeatable price!

Reviews.Title: Very happy with this camera.
Reviews.Author: gee
Reviews.Content: While I enjoy taking pictures I am not a professional photographer.However I am an artist who makes glass art/jewelry and then I sell it online.Straight out the box I was able to get pictures of my stuff that are just fantastic.WAY beyond my 14.7MP non-DSLR!I bought some upgrade lenses but you really don't need anything extra to get great shots.I know value and for my money this at $499 is bang for the buck.

Reviews.Title: Perfect upgrade
Reviews.Author: sweeneyp
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have been reviewing DSLR's for a couple months now, and as far as bang for the buck goes, this camera does it all.  It is a big upgrade from a regular point and shoot and has full range of adjustments.  Sure, there are probably better ones out there, but this one does everything you need it to do, and then some.

Reviews.Title: Artist's tool
Reviews.Author: Mark Howard
Reviews.Content: This camera has exceeded my expectations. I am basically a plein air painter, but this camera will enable me to add exceptional details to large paintings created in my studio.The camera will also give me enormous amonts of information from places I cannot paint, such as from a moving boat underway, or from a hike on a mountain.The digital capability of this camera also makes it feasible to create a very large library of subject matter that I can draw from to create unique landscape paintings.Finally, since the camera is digital, I can record, and build libraries of all the work I make without having to resort to the old method of making slides.

Reviews.Title: This is the one
Reviews.Author: Happy Camper
Reviews.Content: I have had point and shoot cameras for the longest time.  I am new to SLR's and have to say there is not comparison.  I absolutely love this camera.  Easy to use and the picture quality is amazing.Love it!

Reviews.Title: Excellent camera
Reviews.Author: Beatriz M. "Beatriz"
Reviews.Content: I am an amateur in photography. For several months I was looking for an affordable camera easy to use that will deliver high quality photos. I compared this camera with other brands; I also read reviews from customers to be certain that I was making a good decision.I am pleased with the purchase, I am enjoying the camera and learning its features.

Reviews.Title: Its like you are there in the room when you look back on the photos
Reviews.Author: Dw
Reviews.Content: the idiots guide to this camera:I am no photographer just a girl with a baby and a need for a camera.bought this one and love it.easy to use settings that go back and forth between excellent manual and easy automatic.picks up on light so amazingly well that even in dim situations everything is crisp and clear.takes photos and videos like you are right there ( I had to erase any and all photos of my son sad or upset because when I look back it makes me want to wipe his tears and it makes me all teary. its like he is there with me. crazy realistic)when we first took pictures and I saw myself I went. what? this is what cameras look like when they take good pictures. takes some getting used to because it is so real . so nice.it can take very beautiful photos because it can take rapid photos and you get every moment. took christmas photos and its like a flip book of movement. sent them to my grandma and she was stunned.I wouldnt buy anything less anymore and cant wait to buy some accessories.great wide angle already.colors will leave you breathless.love the camera charger, plug into the wall.great zoom and focus.best value ever!

Reviews.Title: Great for amateur photography
Reviews.Author: R. Mohammed
Reviews.Content: This is my first digital SLR and it's a definite improvement from a point and shoot. Pictures are really clear and crisp, and colors are fantastic. Wasn't hard to learn the basics; included documentation is sufficient. Will need to get a zoom lens though. Battery time is fair, about 3 - 4 hours at full charge. All in all, for an amateur, its great.

Reviews.Title: Best Camera at this price
Reviews.Author: Laks
Reviews.Content: I just bought this camera after taking advice from my friends. The camera is light weight and got a rich cool look. I took some pictures of the moving and static objects, and both types came out to be very neat and crisp :)

Reviews.Title: good pic with this camera at this price
Reviews.Author: Anna
Reviews.Content: It is a good SLR camera at this price. Since I am new learner in photograph, and I took pics mostly of people, I can only tell it makes good details about people. Compare to my old digital camera, my advice is that if you have a little more budget, please buy SLR cameres, like this one, it costs a little more, but the pics are quite better than the regular ones.

Reviews.Title: Canon eos rebel T3
Reviews.Author: A. Horton
Reviews.Content: Have always had cannon products, even manual AE-1 program.  This is all I need and then some.  Perfect weight. don't know how to do half of what it does, but am learning quick.  Love the quality of pictures.  Have not gotten to the movie mode yet.  Worth the money for what is inculded.

Reviews.Title: By far the best bang for the buck
Reviews.Author: part timer
Reviews.Content: I am a novice photographer.  But I'm tired of point and shoot pictures.  This camera takes GREAT pictures right out of the box, using the automatic mode.  However, I also enjoy tinkering with the settings, and seeing the results.  It is very easy with this camera.  It's almost hard to take a bad picture.  The video is also quite good.  I am extremely satisfied with the value I received.  Unless you are a professional photographer wanting a high end DSLR, you will love this camera.  Plus the battery has good longevity.

Reviews.Title: Great camera!
Reviews.Author: Ccrider
Reviews.Content: My wife wanted an upgrade from a point and shoot so she got it!. Camera takes great pictures right out of the box. Very small learning curve in auto mode. I hope she really gets more into photography to use all the features this camera offers. The price from Amazon was better than I could find anywhere else. Very happy with the purchase, product and service.

Reviews.Title: Great camera for the price!
Reviews.Author: thewisegirlwins
Reviews.Content: I own a Nikon D60 and bought this as a gift for my mom. Was a bit suspicious of it since it's not the "i" series and when I took it out of the box it was a bit plastic-y. However, after playing around with it - it takes AMAZING pictures! And has high-quality video that you can manipulate with the zoom and manual focus. I hope to be able to purchase one for myself soon and I highly recommend it for anyone looking for their first (or second!) DSLR camera.

Reviews.Title: Fantastic camera for the cost!
Reviews.Author: K.W.  Jax. Fl.
Reviews.Content: I made this purchase for my daughter at Christmas, and she was just blown awaywith all the bells and whistles. Just like all Canon cameras I have owned itperformed great.

Reviews.Title: very nice one! nothing to claim!
Reviews.Author: fsedfpokmpto234
Reviews.Content: good lenses. large capacity of batteries. very convinient user interfaces as always with Canon. nice for persons who want to feel like a professional (but need to learn a lot to be it)

Reviews.Title: Canon EOS Rebel T3 12.2 MP CMOS Digital SLR with 18-55mm IS II Lens and EOS HD Movie Mode (Black)
Reviews.Author: Borislav Stefanov "lionheart"
Reviews.Content: Excellent product. Great service. Works perfectly. We are very pleased with the camera. Takes incredible pictures. Thank you very much.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Gary Benko "Gary"
Reviews.Content: This camera is easy to use and takes great photos.Bought a few lenses with it and i'm really loving it. Easily uploads to my computer.All and all a great camera.

Reviews.Title: Excellent SLR
Reviews.Author: A. Agnihotri "jumbo"
Reviews.Content: Excellent quality pictures.  With the 55-255 mm lens pictures of farther away things are excellent as well.The deal was pretty goof Amazon too.  Two extra lenses, printer and lens cover for ~$962.  Pretty cool.

Reviews.Title: Great starter SLR!
Reviews.Author: Olson family
Reviews.Content: We got this camera after several friends encouraged us to try it out. The camera is easy to use - we have no photography or any creative background. The pics come out awesome. The Auto mode is easy but we do use the others as well. The action mode has allowed us to get the perfect shot of our baby.I would definitely recommend this to anyone just starting out with an SLR.

Reviews.Title: I Make Money With This Camera.
Reviews.Author: francis cyrus
Reviews.Content: I do wedding Videography. the Quality of this camera is HD. if i show you the work i have done with this you won't believe it. at the end of the day. it's not the CAMERA that matters, it's the PERSON operating it.

Reviews.Title: Best Camera Ever.
Reviews.Author: ande_rose
Reviews.Content: I wanted something that took professional looking pictures, even though I'm not a professional by any means. Reading around about cameras it seems a lot of people believe " it's the angle of the shot and that any camera can take a professional picture" Bull. This camera takes pictures that look professional without even trying. I'm constantly chasing my two year old with it! LOVE LOVE LOVE IT!

Reviews.Title: The conforming rebel
Reviews.Author: JL
Reviews.Content: Excellent camera. My son, 13, is the owner;he recieved it for Christmas. He has taken countless pictures with the camera already has commented about its ease of use, quality shots, creative capbility and great battery life. Loves the camera so much that he made a montage for it on youtube: sldnck162 -canon t3 rebel. check it out.I was raised with the old 35mm rebel and resisted the craze for the digital slrs. On that note might ask santa for one to me next year!

Reviews.Title: Awesome camera and fast delivery
Reviews.Author: kj
Reviews.Content: I ordered this camera a little late to get for Christmas and didn't think it would be here in time. The tracker said estimated delivery Dec 21-27 and it came the 20th! I was so excited to have it before Christmas!! The company I got it from seems to be very good at packing and shipping, and delivering a quality product for a good price! I am just wanting a camera for my little girl and family stuff and I think this camera will be perfect!! The picture quality is good to!!

Reviews.Title: Good entry level, cheap plastic feel
Reviews.Author: G.C.
Reviews.Content: This camera has good specs for its price being an entry level dslr. Yet the build and materials is quite disapointing. Feels cheap and very light. It has an all hard plastic body with no rubber grips. Feels like its going to slide out of your hands. It is very off balanced, front weighted with any decent lens longer than 50mm.

Reviews.Title: Great product for the price
Reviews.Author: Ji-yeung Jang
Reviews.Content: This is a light weight economic camera that produces great quality pictures. I've been loving taking pictures of my kids with this camera.

Reviews.Title: Great entry-level SLR
Reviews.Author: relbelle
Reviews.Content: I'm new to photography and I got this for my first SLR. From the research I did, this appeared the be the cheapest good entry-level camera. After using it for a few photo shoots I am pleased. It works great for my purposes: learning how to use SLR functions and how to use lighting.

Reviews.Title: Great camera for the Price!
Reviews.Author: Ositolc
Reviews.Content: I gave it a 5star, because it's a nice camera and it take great pictures, i have seen different ones before and didn't like how the pictures look, and when i took my first picture with this camera image was great and it looks clearly. Battery life is good, it can last up to 1 month with out to charge the battery again, we used it alot with our first granddaugther. Overall it's a great camera for the price and would recomend it to anyone (actually my daughter bought one after we did).

Reviews.Title: Good camera!
Reviews.Author: JEM
Reviews.Content: Love this camera so far and still haven't even figured out how to use half of the functions.  Been very happy with the ease of use and the photos.

Reviews.Title: Intuitive menu
Reviews.Author: Old School Photographer
Reviews.Content: One thing I absolutely hate as I grow older is complexity.  Having had a Canon 20d previously, moving around the menu items meant losing that shot as I fumbled with the layers of menu items.  Not so with the T3.  This camera's menu is very intuitive with very little needing to identify as the on-screen display describes what you are choosing.  I've seen many buy prosumer DSLR's with no camera knowledge thinking they will produce award winning photos only to sell them on the open markets because of the confusing array of camera settings they must remember.  If you're a point and shoot kind of person and wants something a bit more sophisticated than that pocket camera or iPhone camera, maybe a Bridge Camera would suffice.  If however you are looking to experiment a bit with lighting, depth of field or just want to look more professional at your next graduation event, then a DSLR that is easy to use is what you want, and the Canon T3 fits that without straining the wallet too much.Remember, while everyone's shooting with their pocket cameras and you're out there with a nice professional looking setup, they will expect you to produce some really great stuff compared to their's.  If you don't know how to operate your expensive looking DSLR, your photos will make you look like an idiot with crappy pictures.Looking good out there with the T3 and shooting good photos because the camera is easy to use and produces great shots will make you the hero at the next family reunion.Intuitive menu selection, a great variety of lenses to choose from and light-weight, the 12.1 mp Canon T3 will serve you well providing you with creative options as well as the fail-safe point and shoot mode.  I've always believed a camera is only as powerful as the user's ability to use it 100%.  If you don't understand camera lingo, then all those bells and whistles mean nothing, like never taking that Porsche out of 2nd gear.Bottom line, the Canon T3 is well suited for the beginner DSLR camera buff, or old school 35mm manual only camera guys like myself who as we age, simplicity is what we desire.  If you want to graduate to more elaborate DSLR's Canon will get you there with their MKIII series Full Frame cameras, which by the way will use the same Canon lens mounts you will collect as you become more adept at your T3.  You can't go wrong with the T3.

Reviews.Title: Great for pictures anywhere!!
Reviews.Author: Jackie
Reviews.Content: I do photo shoots all the time! Love this camera. Between this camera and the guide on making "perfect photos" helped me with my new business!![...]

Reviews.Title: Another great Cannon product
Reviews.Author: DHD
Reviews.Content: This was a present for my wife, who is just a notch below a professional photographer, and was a replacement for her failing SLR camera she had used for years. Not being a great fan of change, she was a little anxious at first but after a few days she greeted me with a large smile and said how much she like this camera and was so glad that I got it for her. Life is good with a happy wife!

Reviews.Title: Not  a single problem
Reviews.Author: Sarah
Reviews.Content: I just recently witched from an old, hand-me-down Canon Digital Rebel EOS XT--it still used CF instead of SD for memory and thought it was 2004 when I reset it manually--and I could not be happier.I was slightly concerned, when I first got the T3, that I would be confused by or missing out on newer features that my old DSLR did not have, but Canon's standard settings and interfaces are so similar, it's nearly impossible to get stuck trying to figure something out.The photo quality is wonderful, especially after upgrading from eight megapixels, and the versatility in the shutter speeds, apertures, and ISOs is a great, positive upgrade from the more limited options of older Canon DSLRs.A plus: my old hot shoe flash is still universally compatible with the T3, which is nice!All in all,  wonderful choice! I'm incredibly pleased.

Reviews.Title: canon camera
Reviews.Author: comp12
Reviews.Content: a very sophisticated camera with a lot of advanced features, it takes a bit to get to know all the features without reading the manual (a must read to operate, otherwise not very fogiving). The bottons and features are not intuitive and self-explanatory; assumes you already know something about photography. It is a semi professional camera. It is certainly not point and shoot evn on full auto mode. The quality of pictures, once taken right, are simply amazing.

Reviews.Title: Great quality for the price.
Reviews.Author: ebay8503
Reviews.Content: This camera is great! Takes amazing pictures, is rather sturdy (considering it is mostly plastic), and has plenty of options to keep you busy. For those who are used to the Cannon/Fuji/Kodak point and shoots, this is a great introductory DSLR. It's not too pricey, but it is priced high enough to make you want to take care of it.As a WARNING: The lens will scratch easily. Took it to a wedding and somehow there's a scratch. I just used a micro-fiber cloth and buffed it out. I suggest the getting Zeikos ZE-FLK58 58mm Multi-Coated 3 Piece Filter Kit (UV-CPL-FLD) in the 58mm. This will help keep the lens safe. Also, I suggest the Canon Deluxe Gadget Bag 100EG. This has plenty of room, for the camera and a few extras. Is build nice and keeps its contents relatively safe from bangs and bumps.All in all, a great camera for the money. I've used the higher ended Cannons and the biggest differences are the functions and the fact that they are made more of metal than plastic like this model is. Takes wonderful pics, is great to shoot, but nothing super up close (you will need a better lens for that).

Reviews.Title: Good camera for a newbie
Reviews.Author: Monica L.
Reviews.Content: I bought the camera a few months ago (maybe around end of December) and I've been using it for a while.  I just transitioned from a point and shoot to this one because I have a baby and I wanted to get better pictures for scrapbooking and also to display around my house. My dad is a photographer so it wasn't that hard to learn how to use one of this cameras, but dad wasn't always around me so I have to figure out a couple things about light exposure, speed and all that.  Overall, the camera has been working fine for me. Maybe when I get more knowledge about how to play with exposure and all that I might transition to a better one, but for now so far so good and I like the brand too.

Reviews.Title: You Can't Go Wrong With This Camera
Reviews.Author: umeweall "Packrat"
Reviews.Content: I was looking at purchasing the T2i, as it could do 18 megapixels. Why? Would I really need to be concerned about the megapixels at the highest level. I am currently shooting with a Canon 300D, which goes way back in time, but still takes good pictures. I has a whole 6 megapixels. The Canon T3 gives me TWICE that of what I have currently. The T2i would have given me THREE TIMES the megapixels. I decided that it was not necessary for my standard picture shooting, and was over-kill for my needs. As for the 1080p video, versus the 720p on the T3, that also is fine, as I really do not intend on using the camera for shooting video. For those intending to use this as a primary video taker, they may be interested in the articulating screen that the T3i has.  I have a camcorder, which shoots in HD, @1080p, that fits in my pocket--very portable. As for the screen, on the T2i, which some professionals were all hyped up about, I don't care that the resolution is higher on the screen. I review pictures on my computer, not on the camera. I have also found that I want to see a full sized picture, on my monitor, not a shrunken midget, on a tiny screen. I will occassionally do a quick review of a picture, just to make sure that I got what I wanted in the frame, but that is it. The end result being that the screen on the T3 is just fine for me. Now for the rest of the features, I compared the T3, T3i, and T2i, on the Canon site, and there is otherwise only a fraction of a difference between them. The difference was not enough for me to fell that I would be missing something, by buying the T3. For the extra money that the T2i costs, I bought a 50mm, f/2.5 lens for my new camera (well, I had to chip in a few more bucks! I also had to battle other would-be buyers on Ebay to get it!).
