I stuck with the Canon line, as having had my 300D for years, it has served me well (and yes, I plan on keeping it, as a back-up). The lens will work on the T3, as they would have also worked on the T2i, or the T3i. Basically the T3 gave me the majority of the features incorporated into the T2i, and T3i, that I actually needed. I was not intereste in spending the extra money for the 'fluff'.

Reviews.Title: Excellent camera!
Reviews.Author: Paula McDonald
Reviews.Content: LOVE this camera - pictures are amazing. The only thing I don't like is that when you shoot an HD video, it is in .MOV format.  Unless you have software you can't do anything with it except view it in Quicktime.

Reviews.Title: So happy I finally bought this camera!
Reviews.Author: Brandi M Perry
Reviews.Content: I have wanted this camera for a long time, and the price was finally right. It takes beautiful pictures, right out of the box. I got it so that I can take pictures and videos of my two toddlers. Now I need to learn how to use all of the features!

Reviews.Title: Canon T3 - A nice camera!!
Reviews.Author: W. Rogers "Buck"
Reviews.Content: I recently decided to get a camera that could take photos of objects that were farther away, as I have an impending vacation where a lot of the views are going to be difficult to capture.  My current point and shoot with digital zoom lens was just not doing what I wanted it to do.  I started looking at Canon Rebel products and settled on the T3 model.  This camera allowed a 'rookie' like me to be able to auto set the camera to get started, and then progress to various settings as I became more familiar with it.  I did purchase the additional 55-250mm lens to go along with the 18-55mm one that came with it.Overall, what helped sell me on this camera?....... the autofocus and stablizer features to start with, then the overall price that I found the camera and lenses here on Amazon.  (No other dealer, either online or locally in Phoenix has since beat the price in their ads).I was also looking for a camera that I could use the live view in the rear screen as well as the viewfinder.  I wear glasses and this sometimes does not make the small viewfinder the easiest to use.  One additional feature I found appealing was the video recording function.  I carry a 16gb SD card for photos, and when I know I will be doing video I have another 16gb SD card to use.One disappointment was the instruction manual....while the included paper manual gave some startup tips, the more in-depth manual is on the included CD and not at all convenient to have available if you need to look up a questioned feature.  I ended up buying a 'Dummies' book that makes the learning curve a lot easier.Overall I am impressed with the feel of the camera in my hands, and the nice quality photos that it takes.  I would highly recommnend this camera to anyone that wants to 'step up' a notch to a better than point and shoot style camera.

Reviews.Title: Great entry level SLR camera
Reviews.Author: Pete
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera for my daughter as a Christmas present this year and so far we couldn't be happier with it. Takes great pictures, videos, and is fast enough for great action shots. My only issue was with shipping. It took longer than the estimated delivery date. I emailed the vendor through Amazon and was amazed at the response time. They informed me that because of the holidays they were a bit behind and that they would expedite it out to me as soon as possible. I got the camera three days later just before Christmas so all was good. Once again I saved a bit of money going through Amazon, and got great response back from the vendor for the shipping delay.

Reviews.Title: First Digital Cam
Reviews.Author: Terry White
Reviews.Content: This is my first digital camera other than my phone cam.  I had an old film type SLR camera back in the 70's that I learned on but just got away from using it and had started just shooting video. So when I got this camera and started learning all the really cool features I was amazed.  The auto focus leaves a little bit to be desired it takes a while and sometimes I still have to move to manual but that's Ok as long as there is enough light to focus with. But all in all I love this baby.

Reviews.Title: My first DSLR
Reviews.Author: AudLee
Reviews.Content: First time I ordered my camera it had a manufacturer's error and I had to send it back in. Thanks to Amazon's replacement policy I was able to get a new one free of charge within a week! The camera is great and I enjoy using the standard lens that comes with it. Can't wait to buy more lenses and flashes!

Reviews.Title: T3: My Advancerment from Point and Shoot to DSLR
Reviews.Author: Mike Acker
Reviews.Content: I give my EOS Rebel T3 a 5* rating: it is more than i expected!! I have an elaborate set-up for the OM/2 gathering dust.  But, having done a lot of photography with the OM/2 I had a set of expectations: The Rebel T3 needed to do the same sort of things that the OM/2 camera system did.First off was evaluation of the lens. The Rebel cameras using the APS-C sensor (22.2 x 14.8mm) have a "crop factor" of 1.6 which means you take the focal length of an EF-S type lens times 1.6 to get the equivalent 35mm "full frame" focal length.  So the lens that comes with the T3 is 18-55 mm APS-C or ~ 28 to 90 in full frame (36 x 24 mm) 35mm format. Close focus capability is included.  This is an excellent lens to start out with.  The old advice, when purchasing a camera: get and keep the standard lens certainly apples here.  This 18-55 lens is also called the "Kit" lens and it is  ideal for every day shooting, including birthday parties and such.In learning Digital Photography I have found the T3 to be a good "stepping stone": it includes a number of "pre sets": or "automatic" modes for portraits, pets, close ups, sports, landscapes, automatic, night and such that let you take the camera out of the box, charge the battery and start taking great pix with only a brief session with the "getting started" manual. You do need to learn to charge the battery and install and format the memory card ( be sure to buy one ). And get the lens hood if you shoot out doors. Set the camera on AUTO and go to it!!  You can learn to use the additional features at your own speed, as you need them.The package includes a CD with some *very* good photo editing tools that let you download pix from the camera and then edit your collections.  Great stuff, very useful if you like to Play with Pix on Computer -- as is very popular these days!!Speaking of Playing with Pix on Computer if you are into OnLine sharing, FB, Windows/Live etc you will likely find images in the range of 1024x768 pix are adequate for casual online sharing. Images online do not need to be larger than you can display on-screen.  For this reason the 12 m/px T3 will probably be all that is needed for sharing pix online.  12 m/px is 4272x2848 -- much bigger than you need for on-line sharing!!* The 18 m/px of the T3i would be desirable for higher level work, particularly printing where you will want to change the image to 300 dpi or even to 1200 lines/inch.  But that is another subject entirely; those interested in this area will likely want to start looking at the EOS 60D and possibly settle on a full frame model discussion of which is beyond my level of expertise.  Although it appears to me that improvements in the sensors -- APS-C and now Nikon's CX -- are going to obsolete the old 36x24mm "full frame" systems.  "IMHO", anyway.  Check out stuff done with the G12 -- using a 1/1.7 (7.6 x 5.7 mm ) sensorLast but not least: the T3 is a great "stepping stone" offering "point and shoot" or camera control as photographer's choice, and as the EF-S type lenses are compatible through the EOS/Rebel line generally -- a lens that you add for the T3 might be used also on a T3i or 60D that you add later -- which you won't do if you go into a "high end" "point and shoot".I have already added the EF-S 15-85 IS lens; I'll comment on that, in a month or so.* the Digital Photo Professional software -- included with the camera -- will let you re-size -- and you can even do a whole set of images in a single "batch" operation -- after you have your selections to upload.  Although the camera will let you shoot smaller size original images, I wouldn't do that: If you get a good one: you can't go back and say: I want full resolution.  Better to shoot all originals at full resolution.

Reviews.Title: Fantastic
Reviews.Author: Will
Reviews.Content: An incredible camera for an affordable price. It has all the features one could want for a DSLR yet is easy enough for even inexperienced photographers to use right out of the box. An enthusiastic 5 stars!

Reviews.Title: Excellent product
Reviews.Author: felozapato
Reviews.Content: This is a great camera for beginners.Amazon service is amazing, i live in Chile and the product was here 5 days after i buy it.

Reviews.Title: Really good camera
Reviews.Author: huey20031
Reviews.Content: I really like this camera it was an upgrade for me.  I like the fact that it does video.  I am really enjoying my camera.

Reviews.Title: A great DSLR camera, especially if this is your first one
Reviews.Author: Natalie L
Reviews.Content: I have absolutely no complaints about this product. I was recently in the market for a new camera and after much research decided to buy this one. We are primarily a Nikon family but I was really drawn to the features and the price of this camera so I went ahead and purchased just before our vacation to Florida. I don't have a lot of experience with DSLR cameras, but was shocked by how easy it was to use. I had no trouble figuring out all the settings and was able to take a great picture pretty quickly. It may not be the newest model but I highly suggest it anyway!

Reviews.Title: Camera for my Wife
Reviews.Author: James E. Rush
Reviews.Content: Purchased the Canon T3 for my wife to replace a point and shoot lost during an Africa trip. She has taken to it nicely. Utilizes all my lenses. Exactly what she needed.

Reviews.Title: best lovely photos
Reviews.Author: Desire Yameogo
Reviews.Content: I was recommended by a friend to choose Canon and she did well. This camera meets all my expectations and I will recommend Canon to all my friends and relatives. Canon is for methe BEST camera.

Reviews.Title: Nice camera
Reviews.Author: Mrstdbk
Reviews.Content: My son wanted this for his graduation present and he loves it.  It takes gorgeous photos and videos.  Nice starter camera for anyone considering taking on photography seriously.  Had it almost a year with no problems.

Reviews.Title: Good
Reviews.Author: Basanta W.
Reviews.Content: This camera is good for those who are beginner in photography like me. Easy to learn, good quality photos and attractive size are the lovable features of this items.

Reviews.Title: You get what you pay for and this is worth every dime.
Reviews.Author: Michael E. Hyjek "whohamm127"
Reviews.Content: Best camera I ever owned, but just the same I only owned 4 point and shoot cameras. Also I am learning more about the different things you can do with this camera I only had it a short time. Battery life is above what I expected.

Reviews.Title: I love it!!
Reviews.Author: Charlotte Batten
Reviews.Content: I've been using this camera for over a couple of months now and I believe that it is great for anyone who wants to go into photography or just wants to take better family photos. But one thing I do advise is that you learn how the camera works, because it isn't just any regular point and shoot camera. I am a student who is interested in photography so I already know how to use SLR cameras, but for a person who is inexperienced or isn't as knowledgeable with SLR cameras, I think you should buy it with caution or awareness that you will need to either play around with it or just ask your local camera store for help, because even I am learning new and new things as I start using this more. Overall, I think this camera is definitely a must!!!! I appreciated the fact that I also received a camera case, an SD card, and the plug to go with the camera, because I know some sellers make you pay for those items separately.

Reviews.Title: Doesn't support external mic.
Reviews.Author: Indie Film
Reviews.Content: It's a really nice camera but it doesn't support an external mic. If it has HD capabilities it should be able to support an external mic, which really doesn't make any sense that it can't and is incredibly annoying, but this is what I had the money for.

Reviews.Title: The auto focus is hard to work with
Reviews.Author: Tina
Reviews.Content: The camera takes nice enough pictures once you can get the auto focus to get through its gyrations of back and forth and making sounds.  It also just flat out refuses to take pictures in low light, even with the flash set to on.  I am beginning to wonder if I have a defective camera.  I can't take a picture of a shot that might move like an animal or a child because by the autofocus gets done with all its gyrations, my subject has moved and I have lost the shot.  Really frustrating!  I have tried taking it off the auto focus but then the pictures are blurry because there really isn't a way to focus through the camera.

Reviews.Title: Everything I hoped it would be.
Reviews.Author: Dan Travaille
Reviews.Content: Love the ease of operation and great photos that it takes. I used a SLR many years ago, then got away from it with the advent of the point-and-shoot cameras. Photography is fun again.

Reviews.Title: So happy with this camera!
Reviews.Author: Rachel Crawford
Reviews.Content: I gave this camera 5 stars because it's wonderful! I've had mine for almost a year now and I love it even more! This was my first dslr camera. Before I only used Polaroid and my point and shoot. So here is my full review:Get a Canon! Finding lenses that are great quality will be easier and cheaper than if you go for Nikkon. The instructions are easy to read and understand. Youtube will be your best friend while learning how to use it. Btw, it's going to take time to get used to this camera. There is a lot more that goes into it. Start with semi-auto then work your way thru the dials until you're in manual. From there you can choose how you like to shoot.There are a ton of settings, options, and choices with this camera. It's easy to clean and maintain. It fits nicely in the hand, not too big or too small, and with the standard lens even a tabletop tripod can hold it up. This camera has survived the beach, kids, dogs (including my pitbull who is a clumsy dinosaur!), and even being stepped on by my husband during a photo shoot! The body alone is a fantastic investment and the lens does great once you learn how to utilize it properly.

Reviews.Title: LOVE IT!
Reviews.Author: Cheyenne Jade Foster
Reviews.Content: The best camera I have ever owned! I am so pleased with the Canon EOS Rebel T3! It takes clear, focused pictures and I am in love with this camera.

Reviews.Title: hot pixs
Reviews.Author: Julie Close
Reviews.Content: this is a great product. the quality of the images are wonderful, the lens with optional settings, and durability. thanks

Reviews.Title: Great
Reviews.Author: Dewitt Prince
Reviews.Content: My wife feels like a pro with this camera. It is very user friendly.Good battery life .I would reccommend it.

Reviews.Title: Father loves it!
Reviews.Author: Cam ottaviano
Reviews.Content: I bought this cameral for my father and he absolutely loves it. This is a great camera for someone who isn't a professional photographer, he loves the quality of the pictures along with being able to take videos with it. He is a gardner and takes many outside pictures with it and they come out absolutely stunning.

Reviews.Title: Get the T4 or better
Reviews.Author: PrettyinPink
Reviews.Content: This is great for a beginner.  My biggest complain is that when it is in video mode, it does not autofocus.  You have to put the button to focus periodically.  The other thing I didn't consider until I purchased it was the lack of a front screen.  Some of the newer models have a screen you can flip around like a camcorder does.  If you are a YouTuber or like to film yourself, this is not a good choice.

Reviews.Title: Amazons Services is incredible.
Reviews.Author: Sebastian Ibarguen
Reviews.Content: This rating is more with regards to Amazon service as compared to the camera (although it too would receive 5 stars). I first ordered a Canon Rebel T3 and started noticing there was a black smudge in certain pictures, so I did all the basic lens cleaning and ended up finding out it was a problem with the core camera. This must have been 2 months after I had ordered the camera, so the return date had already expired. I didn't have much hope for any solution given the time that had elapse between the order and finding out the source of the problem.I then decided to chat with Amazon service and 4 minutes into the chat, I get an email saying that I will receive a new Canon by the next day! Wow! The only thing I had to do was send the defected camera back.ps. With regards to the Canon EOS, its great. I have tested at big events and with different lenses and works as expected. Takes great shots.

Reviews.Title: Daughet Likes It, Has Held Up Over Time
Reviews.Author: Patrick
Reviews.Content: Two things were key to purchase.1. Daughter wanted picture taker, not video camera. Wanted to take stills.2. For me, the older model was much cheaper than any new model.So, that is it! Good buy.

Reviews.Title: very happy
Reviews.Author: ARON LEFKOWITZ
Reviews.Content: fantastic. this camera takes beautiful photos. I love to use it for products as well as for my kids taking lots of pictures.

Reviews.Title: Gets the job done.
Reviews.Author: Glen Mitchell
Reviews.Content: Very user friendly and gets the job done. I would highly recommend this Camara to anyone trying use a new Camara.

Reviews.Title: First Time Photographer
Reviews.Author: JPansitas
Reviews.Content: This camera is great so far. Not to complicated to use. Size and weight are also pretty good. Comes with more than enough instructions for a beginner like myself. I'm glad I made the purchase. I would recommend.

Reviews.Title: Great!
Reviews.Author: egilbert
Reviews.Content: I'm not into any major photography, I just wanted a nice camera to take photographs of my then infant son. The images come out crisp and clear, and I've also bought a couple lenses in addition to the one that came with the camera.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera!
Reviews.Author: Amanda Hedrick
Reviews.Content: I love this camera. I am taking a beginning photography course and this is a basic camera, yet it takes amazing pictures! Great price.

Reviews.Title: Great photos!
Reviews.Author: Notwithoutmyheels
Reviews.Content: I wasn't sure if to go with the T3 or T3i. I am by no means a professional but I do like to take lots of pictures. This camera takes professional photos. I did mot buy it with the 18-55, but instead bought the body and then the EF 50mm f1.8. Its about the same price as the package with 18-55 lens.

Reviews.Title: Good. Very good product and excellent quality. That's what I was looking for. I really recommend this seller for everybody.
Reviews.Author: Claudio Hideo Martins da Costa
Reviews.Content: Good. Very good product and excellent quality. That's what I was looking for. I really recommend this seller for everybody.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Paul J. Emiro
Reviews.Content: Great Camera.  Lots of features.  Flawless operation.  We had been looking to replace our old Canon film camera with a good digital unit and the Rebel T3 exceeded all of our expectations.  Easy to use.  Still exploring all that the camera can do.

Reviews.Title: Perfect
Reviews.Author: Read Rate and Review
Reviews.Content: Perfect starter camera! I have been wanting a good DSLR camera without having to pay with an arm, a leg, and my first born! This one is great! I can use it to learn the different settings all the while not paying too much until I know what I want and need out of a camera.

Reviews.Title: A great product!
Reviews.Author: CJ
Reviews.Content: It works and provides just what I need! It's functional and it lasts for a long while and the modes on it are great (there is a whole bunch to learn)

Reviews.Title: Cannon Rebel T3
Reviews.Author: Steven J. Ruedy
Reviews.Content: I comparison shopped for a SLR camera and this is the one I selected after "doing my homework".  I have not been disappointed.  It has been referred to as an entry level camera, but I think you could probably make a living shooting it; very versatile.

Reviews.Title: Excellent
Reviews.Author: VESTALIA TORRES
Reviews.Content: Very very good product. I have not had any problems and use is extraordinary. Of course, for those who are starting in the world of photography is perfect. Recommended 100%

Reviews.Title: No good for video
Reviews.Author: Pat  Wing
Reviews.Content: Manual focus is impossible to use out doors as you cant see the display, and viewfinder is inoperable in video mode. Makes a good point and shoot photo camera and that's about it.

Reviews.Title: great camera
Reviews.Author: Ayla Jimenez
Reviews.Content: Came exactly as description of item, very satisfied with camera. Great shooting and recording mode, just what I needed it for. Would recommend to beginners, it's very easy to use.

Reviews.Title: Great camera.
Reviews.Author: don faulkner
Reviews.Content: This is a great camera.  My son needed a SLR camera for a college class.  This is a really nice camera.

Reviews.Title: Rock on, my camera friend, rock on
Reviews.Author: L. C. Cape
Reviews.Content: My wife loves this camera!  She is a novice but wanted to step up and she's enjoying this camera.  She decided to purchase a zoom lens for it so you may want to consider that.

Reviews.Title: Great camera for a great price
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer "Ed Gerrish"
Reviews.Content: This camera takes great pictures and is so much less expensive than some of the other variants.  Take the time to learn enough to not just use "fully auto" and you'll really appreciate the camera's easy-to-use features.  Can't recommend highly enough.

Reviews.Title: Excellent starter camera
Reviews.Author: Johan
Reviews.Content: When I got this camera I was a complete n00b to photography. However, this camera is very intuitive (I thought I was going to have to read the manual, but instead I just started using it and haven't had any questions yet). I love that you can use it in full manual mode, or fully automatic mode. It has excellent image processing, and I really like that it can save pictures in RAW format. The aesthetics aren't something to write home about, but for this kind of a price you can't expect everything to be perfect. As a hobbyist, I think this camera is going to last me a long time!

Reviews.Title: Love this little camera
Reviews.Author: mia evanoff
Reviews.Content: I have had this trusty little camera for a year now. This camera is what got me into doing what I love. Sadly, I will be upgrading to a full frame. If you are an amateur on a budget, this is a great find. Love my t3!

Reviews.Title: great entry to the DSLR world
Reviews.Author: Mikko "IT Manager"
Reviews.Content: This camera is a great one to start with if you are new to the DSLR world.  When you switch to manual mode, not very intuitive when switching between settings, but once you figure that out, the camera doesn't hold you back.

Reviews.Title: Great quality
Reviews.Author: Uvegengby Alice
Reviews.Content: I really like the camera and take great picture and great quality and I also other another lens that show how much I love it

Reviews.Title: Excellent starter camera
Reviews.Author: Boris Yakubchik "professional"
Reviews.Content: I read DPReview.com reviews and saw test photos (as compared to other cameras). This one looked great for its price (low noise, good sharpness with stock lens, etc).My dad uses it now: he started off knowing nothing about digital photography other than "high resolution"; and he's doing great!This camera is easy to use - simple to switch to timer setting for tripod selfies.My brother has professional canon cameras and this one compares nicely - it even does excellent video shooting :)

Reviews.Title: Very pleased
Reviews.Author: Rooster Cogburn III "Rooster"
Reviews.Content: Bought it for my daughter, she is still learning how to fully utilize all the functions.  A fully functional digital SLR at a very reasonable price.  Great!

Reviews.Title: Beautiful Pictures
Reviews.Author: Melissa Kattke
Reviews.Content: Let me begin by saying I am no photographer (yes, I take pictures, but it's not my passion nor is it something I have been trained to do). I bought this camera because I was disappointed with the quality of pictures from my point-and-shoot and wanted to have better quality for printing and putting in albums. And I have to say, I really love this camera. I read through the manual and it gave me a good understanding of how to work the camera. I haven't used a lot of the shooting options, I usually stick to full auto or portrait, and the pictures are just fantastic. I guess my only gripe would be the size. I sometimes don't bring it to events that would look great in pictures because I don't want to be lugging around the case and taking the camera out of the case, putting a lens on, taking the lens off, putting it back in the case (I think this also has to do with my worry about damaging the camera or lens in the process).

Reviews.Title: Happy Camera Owner
Reviews.Author: Jan
Reviews.Content: I am very happy with my Cannon EOS Rebel T3.I wish the lens would take a closer picture. Mypictures are clear and it is easy to operate.

Reviews.Title: My First SLR Cam
Reviews.Author: Violeta Martinez
Reviews.Content: I absolutely love this Camera because I love taking pictures and I love the quality it brings into my life! The picture is so crisp and clean and the settings are fairly easy to understand! It is compatible with several gadgets that I have bought for it such as a detchable speedlight, remote control shutter release, etc.!

Reviews.Title: Great buy!!
Reviews.Author: Spencer
Reviews.Content: Outstanding camera for the price!! Be sure to add a screen protector and an SD card! Awesome features, easy to use, great auto focus!!

Reviews.Title: amazing
Reviews.Author: New Home Owner
Reviews.Content: my wife loves it and the pictures it has taken are incredible.a definite recommendation for anyone looking for a beginner camera that takes great pictures.  i would suggest ordering a carrying bag at the same time before anything gets broken.

Reviews.Title: amazing
Reviews.Author: New Home Owner
Reviews.Content: my wife loves it and the pictures it has taken are incredible.a definite recommendation for anyone looking for a beginner camera that takes great pictures.  i would suggest ordering a carrying bag at the same time before anything gets broken.

Reviews.Title: A must buy!!
Reviews.Author: NGK
Reviews.Content: Love the quality of pictures. Very easy to use for folks who are not that familiar with photography. So happy with this camera!!

Reviews.Title: Good entry level camera: only fault is that mode for action shots is not the fastest
Reviews.Author: Bionic007
Reviews.Content: I am a common consumer of point and shoot cameras, they were all I'd known before this camera. So understand that I am a complete novice. I've played with some of the settings in actual use and they definitely give better shots if you've got time to optimize, and the menus in the camera are good at giving descriptions of the shooting modes and functions. The price was good and from what I can tell the lens is a good intermediate/general use lens.The only drawback I've noted is that the shutter speed is not the fastest and for sports, animals, and children you may miss the perfect shot and catch the one a fraction of a second later.I recommend this if you're on a budget and want a good first DSLR.

Reviews.Title: Best Camera ever
Reviews.Author: Cynthia A Brunner
Reviews.Content: Daughter loves the Canon Rebel.  The combo deal made it a real bargain and we are very happy with the quality of the photos.

Reviews.Title: Nice!
Reviews.Author: Zach
Reviews.Content: Its in pretty good shape. They did not warn me about the mark on the front but its fine. Also they supplied me with a camera case which was not suppose to come with the order so thanks very much! I LOVE IT!

Reviews.Title: Canon t3 all the way to the bank
Reviews.Author: phillip a coffman
Reviews.Content: I have had my Canon t3 now for a month and wow grate pix for only a  12.2 mp have taken photos for the shelter I valinter at and made some famleys staying at the shelter very very happy my only regrat is I bot it at Walmart for 439.00 flash extra 35.00 and  not here at amazon.  But I am very happy with my t3 my neekst thang to by is a 18-200 lens own amazon by june

Reviews.Title: its a great camera
Reviews.Author: Douglas J. Smith, jr.
Reviews.Content: I have fun using it on a cruse I took pictures cam out well. I would highly suggest it to all.

Reviews.Title: Great First Camera
Reviews.Author: Dhamanika
Reviews.Content: This is the first camera I have bought for my person business and it works great. My customers are happy with their pictures and so am I.

Reviews.Title: Awesome.
Reviews.Author: shane
Reviews.Content: I am new to the camera world but, for the price it's awesome. I'm taking pictures with ease and they look great.

Reviews.Title: Very Good Camera for the price
Reviews.Author: Jeffrey Allee
Reviews.Content: The picture quality is great. Perfect for going on trips or adventures because it's not too bulky.Compatible with all other canon lenses which is huge. Very great value for what your getting, I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: Canon Camera
Reviews.Author: Kathy
Reviews.Content: I love this camera.  I need to learn all the ways to use it but it takes awesome pictures.  LOVE IT.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Brooke Shane
Reviews.Content: It takes great photos. No complaints. This is a great camera for anyone who wants to take awesome and great photos.

Reviews.Title: Even a novice can take a great photo
Reviews.Author: Courtney Aristondo
Reviews.Content: I have a 2-year old son (who is the center of all photo activity at our house) that was impossible to catch in the moment with my old camera. Now that I have this one we capture everything. The manual was pretty straight forward and after a few test shots I figured out the best settings for the moment (inside/outside/active/etc). Loving this camera. If you are a novice but hoping to capture special moments this may be the camera. It is a little bulkier than what I am used to, but that doesn't matter. Great pictures.

Reviews.Title: Gift worked!
Reviews.Author: Enrique Vanegas "lookingbooks"
Reviews.Content: My in-law niece are so happy with it. I Think it is good for all even it is not for my use.

Reviews.Title: great camera
Reviews.Author: S.T.
Reviews.Content: This was our first DSLR. It is simple to use in the auto mode. Extreme improvement over powershot camera we've been using. Looking forward to exploring the depth of other modes.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: mary tindukasiri
Reviews.Content: I would recommend this camera to anyone desiring an easy to use, light weight and multipurpose digital camera.I love all of its features. Still experimenting but the learning curve has been very quick.Super fast shipping and service.

Reviews.Title: Daughter Loves It
Reviews.Author: Cloud
Reviews.Content: I bought this for my daughter and she loves it! I have always been a Nikon person but she works with a photographer that uses Canon and so she loves this one as a great starter SLR.

Reviews.Title: Great camera for ditigsl beginners!
Reviews.Author: Brian Sayre
Reviews.Content: I rated this camera so high because the workmanship is excellent and the controls are clearly marked making it easy to change to the desired settings.

Reviews.Title: Makes gorgeous pictures
Reviews.Author: Shannon Morgan
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice starter camera. A professional photographer recommended this particular camera to me and she was absolutely right!

Reviews.Title: My photographer daughter loves it.
Reviews.Author: equinox
Reviews.Content: No complaints. My daughter absolutely loves it. The additional telephoto lens she got makes her happy as a clam to be photographing.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Hamakuapastor
Reviews.Content: Not being a professional photographer, I can't speak to how the T3 stacks up against other cameras. What I do know, is that I have had the camera for about 2 months and taken hundreds of pictures and simply put, "this camera takes great pictures!" It is easy to use and is an amazing upgrade from my Canon PowerShot SX130,

Reviews.Title: Love this thing.
Reviews.Author: Omar
Reviews.Content: I am just now starting to get into photography and decided to pick this bad boy up. I did do my research and I could have gone for the more expensive 18 MP version and with a little more bell and whistles but I opted for this one. I am just starting to pic it up and I feel like it was dumb spending so much money right away and personally I don't think I even need a camera than can take pictures at 18 MP. The camera feels real nice in the hand, the controls are easy to find. I already took this thing to the snow and to the beach and it produces some real nice pics. The kit lens is really good but I decided to buy the EF 50mm f/1.8 II lens. I plan on taking photos of cars more than anything and this lens suits my need a lot better. You can also shot HD video with this camera and I haven't tried it out yet but I am planning on testing it by making a little photo shoot video. I haven't been able to put this thing down, only when reading up on the techniques of photography and then I am right back to shooting. One last thing, the battery life is excellent. I haven't ran out of battery just yet, only down side is no SD card included but they aren't that expensive any more.

Reviews.Title: Canon Rebel T3 Camera
Reviews.Author: Carrie
Reviews.Content: Beautiful camera. Arrived on time. Would like a paper copy of instructions rather than CD if available. Otherwise great working camera and all parts were in tact.

Reviews.Title: Best Camera for the Money!
Reviews.Author: Eileen Burnley
Reviews.Content: An excellent choice for a mid range camera, especially for making videos on the spot; the pictures are clear indoor and out.

Reviews.Title: Gift for my wife - replaced point and shoot camera
Reviews.Author: David Ritter
Reviews.Content: Very happy with quality and package contents.  My wife was able to take photos right  out of the box by adding our own sd card.  an 8Gb card stores about 60 photos.  Menus were easy to follow for setup and use.  Printed quality on a canon pixma 3500 printer are excellent.  Camera shipped quickly, was packaged well and arrived in good condition.

Reviews.Title: Canon T3 is just fine for beginners
Reviews.Author: jon gloege
Reviews.Content: I was looking at the nikon d3100 and this camera for awhile. I just liked the canon body better. Very easy to use and I am slowing learning to use some of the advance features. I got it on an early Black Friday sale for $340 so it was a no brainer.  Really like using the portrait feature.

Reviews.Title: Very nice camera, more features than I can count
Reviews.Author: Mark Barker
Reviews.Content: I have only used this camera a few times but have been very pleased with it.  I was able to use lenses from an older 35mm Canon Rebel, which is nice.  This camera is good in automatic mode but has a lot features that I still have to play with.  You can use the viewfinder or the LCD screen but not both for sighting your frame.

Reviews.Title: Great upgrade over earlier model
Reviews.Author: J. Walters
Reviews.Content: Bought this model because my old one finally died.  Great camera so far and have no issues with it at all.  Easy and light to handle.  Great selection of lenses if you are a big time camera person and also simple if you just want point and shoot as well.

Reviews.Title: A+
Reviews.Author: Great
Reviews.Content: Purchased this camera for a trip to Vegas, I was able to get the bundle package which included a 50mm lens. It surved it's purpose and I was able to get some fantastic photos. Average photographer

Reviews.Title: LOVE IT
Reviews.Author: Deirdre Ann Walsh "Deirdre"
Reviews.Content: Awesome camera; can't believe what we paid for it... great deal, great brand, great potential (lens capability)... for the price!

Reviews.Title: nice DSLR, fairly compact for its capability
Reviews.Author: G. Slippy
Reviews.Content: Good SLR flexibility.  Movie mode is not so great - no through the lens viewing is possible, which means when you're filming at your child's concert, everyone around you gets to watch your viewfinder as well.  I added a 75-300 Canon lens for nice long shots, too.

Reviews.Title: My new baby!
Reviews.Author: richelle pointer
Reviews.Content: I have yet to find any problems. This is my new baby and I try to find excuses to use it in just about every school project. This camera takes great pictures even without flash.

Reviews.Title: Gift
Reviews.Author: Mary K Kaunelis
Reviews.Content: Purchased this camera as a gift for daughter/son-in-law expecting their first child.  They use is constantly, including taking it camping several times.  Works easily and the photos are beautiful!

Reviews.Title: canon
Reviews.Author: Kay D. Matherly
Reviews.Content: gave this as a gift and my daughter in law is in awe of it.  Well designed,  read the instructions and you are good to go.

Reviews.Title: Canon Rebel DSLR
Reviews.Author: John D. Harris
Reviews.Content: i needed a camera that was capable of attaching to my telescope and had accessories that would allow me to take trhough-the-telescope astrophotos.

Reviews.Title: GOOD PURCHASE
Reviews.Author: david antepara "davico"
Reviews.Content: Excellent pictures!!...Even i'm working on fully automatic, i'm learning step by step to manage on manual.  And the video quality is good too!!

Reviews.Title: Good Camera
Reviews.Author: Gerald S. Bringle
Reviews.Content: Works very good.The picture quality is excellent.The camera is easy to operate.The camera is well made and heavy duty.

Reviews.Title: love it
Reviews.Author: Shereen
Reviews.Content: I love the quality of the pictures.for a beginner such as myself, its easy to use the automatic setting, and the more common settings like portrait, landscape...etc but it will take you some time to get to learn how to use it like a professional , you'll need to read or watch a video.

Reviews.Title: Phenomenal beginner DSLR camera
Reviews.Author: CJ Postal
Reviews.Content: I love my Rebel T3. I wanted to wait awhile before reviewing, but it's a great camera to learn the basics with. Great starter body that with simple lens and other upgrades make it well worth the money.

Reviews.Title: Perfect
Reviews.Author: Garrett
Reviews.Content: I love this camera, takes excellent photos, i wish it had wireless capabilities but none the leas its perfect  (Beginner photographer)

Reviews.Title: Excellent quality and price!
Reviews.Author: Veronica Rosas
Reviews.Content: The images are excellent and the rest of the charactheristics are amazing, is my husband who use it for his photography studies and he is so happy for this shop!

Reviews.Title: bought it to my dad
Reviews.Author: ido keren
Reviews.Content: bought it to my dad he is a semi-amateur photographer and he is really happy with operating the camera, over all it seems like a very good relating the money that have been spent on it

Reviews.Title: Worked well
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: It is a good addition to my hardy all weather olympus miu but the flash got stuck (about a month after purchase) which didnt allow user to take pictures. However, it was still under warranty and Canon repaired it. It will take some time for me to discover all the cool functions though.,

Reviews.Title: Great camera bad battery
Reviews.Author: David Mackey
Reviews.Content: Great camera i love it. We have had it for a week and have taken 1000 photos. The cameras battery is crap. It shorts out and we have to frequently recharge it. We ordered a new one but that's the only reason I give it 4 stars.

Reviews.Title: Great camera!
Reviews.Author: jon reagan
Reviews.Content: Been using an SLR 35 mm for many years and now find the digital version a real pleasure! It is light weight and very easy to use . Point and shoot or adjust settings for custom pictures. A great product. I recommend it.

Reviews.Title: Canon EOS Reble T3 Camera
Reviews.Author: Nancy M. Cousins
Reviews.Content: Camera arrived in perfect conditionI have had it for about 4 months and I use it 5 days out of the week.I have had no problems with it.It's easy to use.I would 100% recommend it.Thanks

Reviews.Title: Loved it
Reviews.Author: Rudy Rod
Reviews.Content: This product was in such great shape and almost completely flawless. I know I saved over $500 buying this used camera that is probably in near "new" shape! It was delivered on time and in great shape!

Reviews.Title: Great!
Reviews.Author: Daniel Prioleau
Reviews.Content: This camera is a great starter to begin with. I got my camera on time and am still happy with my purchase ;)

Reviews.Title: cameara
Reviews.Author: Nicolas Kerr
Reviews.Content: I suggest buying the kit which includes the additional 55-250 lens. The kit lens is sufficiently sharp but it might be worth investing in the newer 18-55 STM lens, as it is reportedly sharper than the 18-55 lens included with this camera.

Reviews.Title: Perfect!
Reviews.Author: Cameron Waltsgott
Reviews.Content: this camera is in perfect condition like described! cant wait to start traveling and taking pictures with my new camera!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: ye wang
Reviews.Content: My first DSLR and I'm loving it already. Lens is not bad, colors are vivid, functions are good. Only problem is the auto focus may take a little long, so you have to really press it down and hold sometimes. Otherwise, no complaints. I'm a newly declared Canon fan.

Reviews.Title: We've had this for about 6 months and love it
Reviews.Author: Cyber Shopper
Reviews.Content: Very simple to use and takes great shots. My wife was amazed as she took a photo of a flying bee and had the perfect still photo she's ever seen!

Reviews.Title: Love it!
Reviews.Author: Lisa R.
Reviews.Content: I am not a professional photographer however I wanted a good camera to take pictures of my girls playing softball. This is the camera for an action shot, or still photos. It takes great photos and is easy to learn how to use. Put the thing in manual mode and play with the settings until you learn which settings take the best photos. You wont mess it up. I have the 75-300mm lens as well for this and love the lens because it will reach all the way across the ball field for me to get that perfect shot.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Camera for a great price!
Reviews.Author: Megan Fillette
Reviews.Content: I needed a second/backup camera and I chose this one!  I am shocked at it's features!  It does amazingly and will give you fantastice pictures!

Reviews.Title: I love it
Reviews.Author: Joe Nitta
Reviews.Content: It is very easy to use and take a very good pictures. It is also easy to transfer pictures to computers because of SD card.

Reviews.Title: Canon EOS
Reviews.Author: TJ
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for my 14 year old who takes pictures all the time.  We love this camera, it meets and exceeds our expectations!!

Reviews.Title: Great pics!
Reviews.Author: Brian
Reviews.Content: My Wife and I love it! I bought this for her birthday and we've had it for 6 months now. No problems so far. The pics are quite crisp and of great quality.  We take a lot of pictures of our almost 2 year old Son with it! We've probably easily taken a thousand pics with it by now. It was a good purchase.

Reviews.Title: Love it!
Reviews.Author: Peter W.
Reviews.Content: Really nice camera at awesome price. The camera itself is more than capable of most anything you'll want it to do. The shooting mode options are similar to those on the canon rebel film SLR, and allow the beginner to transition to manual as they become more comfortable with less-automated shooting modes.When you get the kit, there won't be a memory card included, so make sure you've picked one up (16GB would be the lowest I'd recommend, especially if you're a beginner experimenting by taking the same picture a few different ways, it's nice not to have to worry about filling up the memory card. Also if you're using larger file sizes like RAW, the larger card is a good idea.). Otherwise the kit includes everything you need to get started.The manual is okay, though the pdf it comes with doesn't particularly elaborate on anything in the paper manual. However, the camera itself is pretty easy to figure out , especially for someone who is even a little familiar with SLRs, digital or otherwise.I found the battery life to be excellent, and there's a handy indicator on the screen to let you know when it gets down to half. It seems to charge pretty quickly, a couple of hours at most.The pictures it takes are true to life and look very professional. It's a lot of fun for someone just getting into digital photography or for the hobbyist with some familiarity. I'd strongly recommend picking up a camera bag, you'll find yourself wanting to take this camera with you wherever you go. If you want a little more freedom than the kit lens provides, a good option to consider is an 18-300 lens that will let you get some telephoto capability without sacrificing the ability to grab that picture of your friends sitting next to you.I ordered it here at Amazon, price is really awesome: http://amzn.to/19M6Pf8

Reviews.Title: Excellent Entry Level SLR
Reviews.Author: laksh
Reviews.Content: A fine product for those stepping up from point and shoot cameras, the speed of SLR cameras beats almost all point and shoots and lets you get shots which the point and shoot could never get due its slow speed. Dust is not really a problem unless you keep changing lenses often and the lack of inbuilt dust cleaning is not really a deal breaker. Good Image quality even in Jpeg format but requires some post processing in photo editing software.Overall offers the best value for money for those looking for a starting SLR on a modest price, the DPP(Digital Photo Professional) software is very good for entry level users which is included free with the camera. The included 18-55 kit lens is a upgraded model compared to the previous versions and gives very pleasing images and good sharpness when used at the right apertures.

Reviews.Title: Awesome camera for the price!
Reviews.Author: steve anderson
Reviews.Content: this camera is greaat!Mainly for photos but it can do videos also!durable little camera, feels cheap but its really strong and durable.the kit lens is actually really good too don't listen to the other people.get a prime lens with this camera!cheersMy YouTube chanel is SooperHBOMB

Reviews.Title: Just what I was looking for!
Reviews.Author: L. Romanic "HomeSchoolMom"
Reviews.Content: I have been using an old point & shoot camera for a number of years, and it was starting to act its age :)  I decided that I wanted something "more" for my next camera.  A few fellow baseball parents had a similar camera and I decided to give it a try.  I love it!  I still haven't had time to read the manual & figure out how it all works, but so far, so good!  I definitely would like to purchase an additional lens for better zooming capabilities, but this is fine for now.

Reviews.Title: Wonderful camera!
Reviews.Author: David Mash
Reviews.Content: Wonderful, easy to use camera that takes a wonderful picture everytime.  No matter if you use all of the manual settings or the automatic settings this Canon is great for entry level photographers.

Reviews.Title: Easy To Use And Takes Great Pics
Reviews.Author: Albert A. Teller
Reviews.Content: We bought this for my son to help him shoot great track and field pictures. He's become a photography buff so he was looking for a good camera that would work well. He loves it and figured it out quickly. Intuitive and capable machine.

Reviews.Title: great starter for dslr photography
Reviews.Author: Hector
Reviews.Content: love this camera, as i read through forums books & reviews.. this was a nice and quality dslr camera body to start shooting!so now its my travel mate. with very basic instructions from "Canon EOS Digital Rebel Xti For Dummies" i was able to shoot very nice pictures. now im printing & framing them.you can go for $500+ body but this one (i purchased the kit with 18-55mm lens) will let you start and learn the very basics with pro-resultsi do recommend this camera to a friend, and to get it from amazon ;)

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: joe.gilpinjr
Reviews.Content: Great Camera!!! amazing quality photo's. Light, compact and portable. Still need to make some time to learn all the great feature. I love it!

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Racegirlrach
Reviews.Content: Excellent quality pictures.  The video portion is also high quality.  Camera is easy to use and lightweight. You get a great camera for the price.

Reviews.Title: Great camera at a good price
Reviews.Author: M. Everton "yakmaster"
Reviews.Content: We bought this camera as part of a bundle and it was a great price.  We have owned Canon cameras for years and are very satisfied with the performance and durability.  It does everything we want and more.

Reviews.Title: Awesome Camera
Reviews.Author: Peter
Reviews.Content: I've owned this camera for a year now and I love it. The Canon EOS Rebel T3 definitely lived up to my expectations.The max 6400 ISO really helps out in low-light situations.Three-frames per second is good, however I wish it was higher.Either way I am still able to capture great sports shots. I love the camera settings. The images come out so vivid and crisp. 12.2 megapixels and the HD video really bring my images to life. I am very impressed with the camera. Doesn't matter what the event is, this camera never disappoints me.Battery lasts a long time, I just charge once and I'm good to go.I love this DSLR and it was definitely worth buying.

Reviews.Title: Purchased for my daughter
Reviews.Author: Paula
Reviews.Content: I have a T2 rebel and my daughter was very jealous so for her b-day. She loves it. I just went to visit her in Portland and we spent five days taking pictures. The ocean, fireworks, flowers, water falls... It was great and the pictures all turned out great! Not too hard to use, my daughter is a graphic designer and she figured out all the features! Came in two days and was packaged just fine.

Reviews.Title: LOVE this camera
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I am just thrilled with this camera.  I've had a couple of digital point and shoots and thought I needed the small size they offered.  Can't believe what I've been missing.  Love everything about this camera.  I'm hauling around a diaper bag anyway... might as well use the phone as a phone and use this for stunning pics.

Reviews.Title: Perfect for newbies
Reviews.Author: Charles J Parker
Reviews.Content: Never used an DSLR, always used the pocket cameras.  First time dipping into the world of SLRs.  Great product to do just that. Easy to use and understand.  Guides you into each feature.  Try and use each feature to learn what each does.  Expands with different lens for greater use.

Reviews.Title: Excellent
Reviews.Author: Bo Liu
Reviews.Content: This is a very professional camera. Very high quality photos are taken with this one. Very easy to use and comfortable. Thanks.

Reviews.Title: Love It!
Reviews.Author: Haleigh
Reviews.Content: This is my first DSLR camera, and I'm in love with it! I also like how the screen guide makes it easier to figure out what each setting does. A++ in my book.

Reviews.Title: LOVE this camera!!
Reviews.Author: Patriot
Reviews.Content: I am very happy with my camera!  It is easy to use and I love the way the pics look!

Reviews.Title: Camera delivers results
Reviews.Author: Bruce A. Watson
Reviews.Content: I still haven't used most of the features, but the ones I have used were easy understand and delivered beautiful pictures.

Reviews.Title: Four and a half stars
Reviews.Author: ricardo_guerrero "ricardo_guerrero"
Reviews.Content: Admission: I'm a complete newbie to photography.  I had to take a class that required a DSLR camera.  I looked around, and the cheapest ones for purchase at stores in my area were $700-800.  Way more than I wanted to spend.  I bought a Nikon D1 (I later found out this camera was first issued in 1999) for $100 off ebay, and lo and behold, the thing didn't even work anymore. I sent it back to the seller and got a refund.  But, I still needed a camera.  The Canon Rebel T3 was the cheapest one out there, yet Canon is always a reliable brand, so I knew I wouldn't be disappointed, and so far, everything has been good.  Very easy to set up and meter shots, although the camera is very very picky about focusing, especially when shooting landscapes.  It will not let you take the shot unless everything is as clear as possible.  The Rebel is most definitely less complicated and much more user friendly than almost any other DSLR camera out there, which is definitely good for those like myself who have never used anything other than point-and-shoot cameras prior to purchasing the Rebel.  The price...errrr, maybe it could be a bit lower.  $350-375ish (and not $499) would be appropriate.  I paid $400, which I think was "fair."  I'd recommend it to anyone - seems like a great, and relatively lightweight, camera for someone taking photos while on vacation, where a heavy/bulky DSLR would be inconvenient.

Reviews.Title: Pretty Handy!!!
Reviews.Author: LUIS ROSAS
Reviews.Content: It is a good and basic camera. It comes in handy when you are starting in the world of fotography.

Reviews.Title: this is it

Reviews.Content: good oppertunity for learers ../..the capturing capacity is excelent /..Really love it . looking for a next lense once done with this

Reviews.Content: This camera is very ascetically pleasing and takes wonderful photos. The camera has a nice shutter speed and simple buttons for navigation. The pop-up flash is very handy and reliable. It does take a while to focus,but its better than having blurry photos!

Reviews.Title: Thrilled
