Reviews.Content: My wife was thrilled with this product.  She has been taking pictures for years, but not with a camera at this level.  This was easy for her to figure out and was take pictures in a few minutes.  After reading the manual she was able to improve her skills and understanding of the product.  Appropriately priced.

Reviews.Title: Nice camera
Reviews.Author: JCMESSIAS
Reviews.Content: Very good product quality, this is all I expected to get.I recommend to other buyers those are thinking to buy that.

Reviews.Title: Fantastic introduction into DSLR's
Reviews.Author: Travis Johnson "ZombieWoof72"
Reviews.Content: This camera is a piece of work, I've had it about a month and man, let me tell you this thing takes some beautiful pictures. It's easy to figure out without the manual as well. I did replace the stock lens with a "nifty fifty" just because I like the feel of the photos more than any issues from the kit lens.

Reviews.Title: Nice camera
Reviews.Author: Nimbus
Reviews.Content: This is my first DSLR camera after a long time of fool-proof digital camera use. After testing it around I gained exciting experience that never existed with a fool-proof camera before. It is not that difficult to handle as I first imagined. The manual is easy and straightforward to understand. I spent about 1 hour on the camera before taking it outside to take some real pictures.The video shooting button design is a little bit absurd, though.Overall, it is a nice camera.

Reviews.Title: Great for Novice
Reviews.Author: kyle martinowich
Reviews.Content: Easy to use, understand functions.  Buy enough storage as pictures are so easy to take on this camera as memory card will fill up quick.

Reviews.Title: Perfect camera
Reviews.Author: MP
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera without a clue how good it was. Believe me it takes great pictures and is well worth the money... Thumbs up!!

Reviews.Title: Awesome first "real" camera
Reviews.Author: peabug
Reviews.Content: This was a gift for my teenage daughter.  it came highly recommended by two photographer friends.  She is thrilled with it.  it is easy to use and takes beautiful pictures.

Reviews.Title: Awesome
Reviews.Author: Aeryck S. De Sade
Reviews.Content: I have been into photography for many years, and still use old manual SLRs such as Minolta and Canon, but wanted something that wouldn't break the bank in digital and still be able to take wonderful photos as well as do astrophotography... this camera fits that bill perfectly! Keep in mind that it's cropped sensor camera, so the exposure plane of the sensor is a little smaller than a full sensor frame camera, which translates that your lens selection will show a little differently, but it also means that you have a wide range of lenses and great features! And with image stabilization lenses available, I take macro photos all day long without a tripod and they turn out perfect!

Reviews.Title: BEST INVESTMENT!!! EXCELLENT CAMERA
Reviews.Author: MMartin
Reviews.Content: I was worried about spending too much for an amateur photographer that I wouldn't notice a big difference in my pics so quickly. Very pleased!!! I really enjoy having better quality pictures for myself, friends, family and events. You can become familiar with it easily.  ALL of my pics so far are amazing! Great settings and stabilizer. From portraits to sports events to capturing the pretty Spring flowers. I am happy!Great quality, great camera., great buy Decent price for decent pics and video!!!!!!  No regrets.  For new photographers, with patience you'll get the hang of it and like this this too!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Esteban Tapia Ch
Reviews.Content: It takes astonishing photos, the lens that comes with the camera is just ok but if you want profesional photos you can buy more lenses. Works great I recommend it.

Reviews.Title: OUTSTANDING PRODUCT
Reviews.Author: Elizabeth Bryant
Reviews.Content: I was totally excited when I received my package.  The camera was new like the seller said and everything that was listed was in the box.  Everything was still sealed in its own wrapper.  I was totally pleased.  I love this camera.

Reviews.Title: Quick arrival. Excellent product
Reviews.Author: andres infante
Reviews.Content: I did't hae to wait much for it and the camera came to me new and it works great. No problems at all.

Reviews.Title: Nice step up from the world of totally automated point-and-shoot cameras
Reviews.Author: Dale A. Hunscher
Reviews.Content: I'm learning a lot about camera optics from this camera, which allows the user to experiment with different settings fairly freely while still providing a fully automated mode - in fact, several such modes - that produce fine results. I'm sure there are comparable and even better values in other Canon models and similar cameras from other manufacturers, but I'm not equipped to do the comparison and evaluation. I'm happy with the money paid for this model, and am investing leftover cash in additional lenses, etc. rather than buying a competitive camera for the sake of comparison.

Reviews.Title: The perfect gift for my husband
Reviews.Author: J. Schum
Reviews.Content: He wanted a "really good digital camera", so we checked online and this is the one he chose. An old neighbor of his had one, and he used it a few days to be sure. He loves it, and recently took photos of an event in our town for the local TV station. The photos are clear, it's easy to use, and I might just try it myself. I am not a photographer.....yet.

Reviews.Title: Talk about CRISP PICTURES!
Reviews.Author: Brenda Stevens "sisbe"
Reviews.Content: Honestly from the "old" school and was refusing to go Digital. Had a lil pocket camera and well these darn butterfly's, birds, insects...NATURE was popping up all around me and my shots were "caca". Point and shoot just wasn't cutting it. So decided to get a Fuji as it was reasonable in price but now that I have my Canon...well, wish I had someone back then to say "Just invest in the Canon". Still use the Fuji for filming and close up shots but honestly, pics are below par, my Canon's are pristine.LOVE the SPORTS button; click to that and EVERY time get my magic nature shots! See there is a VIDEO REVIEW, would like to show you some comparisons, as we know a picture is worth a 1K words :)  Trust me..you'll LOVE this camera and I take the battery out after every shoot to re charge. NEVER run out and NO MORE buying AA's!!Also bought the Canon EF 400mm f/5.6L USM Super Telephoto Lens for Canon SLR Cameras the combo..marriage made in heaven.

Reviews.Title: Canon EOS Rebel T3 12.2 MP CMOS Digital SLR with 18-55mm IS II Lens!
Reviews.Author: Flora
Reviews.Content: I simply love this camera! product was delivered as promised!  I am now enjoying every moment taking photos of my family especially my kids...I love love love this camera.

Reviews.Title: Great entry level DSLR
Reviews.Author: Justin
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera after purchasing and returning a Sony NEX-5R.  You can view my review of the Sony NEX-5RK/S 16.1 MP Compact Interchangeable Lens Digital Camera with 18-55mm Lens and 3-Inch LCD (Silver) here if you are interested:http://www.amazon.com/review/R26ZBZOECUVLIA/ref=cm_cr_pr_perm?ie=UTF8&ASIN;=B0090QXG92&linkCode;=&nodeID;=&tag;=.This product has met all my expectations.  It is a great entry level DSLR with a GREAT price.  I have thoroughly enjoyed shooting with it.Pros- Great photo quality.  ISO is great up to 1600, and acceptable (in my mind) at 3200.- Menu system is easy to navigate.- Good size.  I don't find it to be overly bulky.  I took it with me to a children's museum and I didn't feel like it got in my way (even while chasing the kids around).- Lens selection is great.  I bought the 50mm f/1.8 and LOVE it (Canon EF 50mm f/1.8 II Camera Lens).Cons- The plastic body does make it feel a little cheaper than the T3i and other similar models, but I'm willing to deal with that for the lower price.- The LCD feels like it's blurry sometimes, but I think that's mainly due to having a higher pixel density phone screen (I have an iPhone 4S).  You get used to it while shooting, but coming from my phone it takes a while to get used to.- Autofocus for movies is bad.  I get better autofocus performance from my Canon SX130IS P&S.;  I'm not sure if I just haven't figured it out yet, and I'm doing some internet research to see if I'm just missing something.  My main usage is for still photos, so it's not that big of a deal to me.I chose this over the T3i because of the lower price point.  This suits me just fine for my first DSLR.I thought about giving this a 4 star rating for the movie AF, but decided against it due to my ongoing research.

Reviews.Title: good camera esp for beginners
Reviews.Author: cjem
Reviews.Content: It does exactly what I bought it for.  Picture quality is exactly what I expected, very clear.  Great price compared to the other cameras I was looking at.  Great to learn basics on.  Very easy to use.  Not too big/clunky.

Reviews.Title: Love it
Reviews.Author: tina
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for my digital photography course. I love the camera, but the lens on it is basic, and I think someone should invest a bit more and buy a better EOS lense for it.

Reviews.Title: Amazing!
Reviews.Author: Sjw
Reviews.Content: I am going to go to school for photography and have had a few cameras but nothing like this one. I absolutely LOVE it. An priced great!

Reviews.Title: good camera
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: great camera at a great price I like that they changed to sd cards instead of compact flash cards much easyer tofind and cheaper

Reviews.Title: Great Canon SLR
Reviews.Author: Louis Baarlaer "No3Putts"
Reviews.Content: Bought this as a replacement for my other Canon SLR. This is an awesome camera. I will get plenty of use out of this one.

Reviews.Title: DSLR Beginner and baby photo-shooter mom.
Reviews.Author: Hyun Park
Reviews.Content: I love this camera.Easy to control for beginner and once I am used to guide  the more options I can try.Mostly for my baby pictures, it generate very warm and nice pictures.Definitely worthy product!

Reviews.Title: Great Price for Quality
Reviews.Author: Nick Corrigan
Reviews.Content: I know very little about photography but from my research knew that I wanted a Canon DSLR.  This camera is easy to use and I have already been able to take some pretty excellent photos by just reading through the basic guide that ships with the package.  Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: Best bang for your buck
Reviews.Author: gtae04
Reviews.Content: This camera is the best value out there.  I have some pro friends and their $2000 cameras are noticabyy better than mine, but I am at least in the game for a fraction of the cost.  Also, had a small issue after a few times using it and Cannon took care of it no questions asked and almost no $ to me.

Reviews.Title: Perfect Camera for a Frequent Picture Taker!
Reviews.Author: Holly
Reviews.Content: I love to take pics of my kids, pics at parties, get-togethers, any special event -- I'm always the one with a camera in my hand. I had a less expensive digital camera (also a Canon) that I bought a few years ago. It was nice, but it took too long to focus (have to hold the button down half-way to focus, then all the way to snap the pic) and I missed a lot of action shots because of it - or they turned out very blurry / out of focus. This is perfect - it's simply point and shoot. You do have to hold the button down half-way to focus, but it focuses almost instantly, so you can really just push down the entire way all at once and you're good. When doing this, I've noticed that it helps to push it down half way to focus (such as when you've changed the 'zoom' on it and it needs to re-focus) and then just snap pictures at random.The battery lasts a long time too! I LOVE this camera!

Reviews.Title: Love it!
Reviews.Author: smileu
Reviews.Content: It was everything i wanted and so much more. The camera came ready to use and was ready to navigate.

Reviews.Title: Great so far
Reviews.Author: Dean Lovsted "Dean Lovsted"
Reviews.Content: so far this camera has far exceeded my expectations the included lens is great and the camera itself is wonderful i purchased this along with the canon ef 75-300mm lens and the canon efs 55-250mm lens as there was a bundle sale and the images are beautiful. on continuous shooting there is not much lag with the 45mb/s memory card and on jpeg mode large file size there is none i shot at 1/4000 and had 300 images with no lag on jpeg format will provide further updates with more usage but i can not see this being poor in quality even for a minor amateur.

Reviews.Title: I love it
Reviews.Author: Nataliya
Reviews.Content: Simple, good quality pictures, works just fine for the beginner like myself. I can recommend it to anyone who wants to have good quality pictures

Reviews.Title: BOUGHT IT FOR $399
Reviews.Author: sunnyctrgrl
Reviews.Content: Great price for what you get.  It takes amazing pictures.  I wanted a DSLR and didn't want to pay too much for my first one.  I only wish it had the swing out lcd (like the t3i) or at least a cover to flip over it.

Reviews.Title: First EOS
Reviews.Author: Rachael
Reviews.Content: Love this camera. This is the first EOS camera I have owned. It is probably the easiest camera I have ever owned, I have only used it a few time,  and so far all the pictures have turned out great. It has really clear and colorful pictures, which is what i want in a camera.  You can use it in auto and automatically let it do its thing, or customize to your own liking. It tells you what you are doing when you turn the dial, which is a really nice feature, my last camera it was like guess until  you get it right.

Reviews.Title: LOVE IT !!!!
Reviews.Author: Allan Clare
Reviews.Content: This camera really put me above my local competitors and the photos speak for themselves. just about every other day,  a new customer  comes along . It also encourages you as well because customers tell how much they love their photographs.

Reviews.Title: Canon EOS Camera
Reviews.Author: Carol Deal
Reviews.Content: My daughter loves he r camera.  It is everything that she wanted it to be.  It arrived in time for Christmas, and since the price was really great, she was really surprised since she wasn't expecting it because they are so expensive.

Reviews.Title: Satisfied
Reviews.Author: Leo
Reviews.Content: As my first DSLR camera, I'm quite satisfied. At 720p, the quality is fantastic, and it's quite simple to use. For it's price, it's a very nice and simple forray into the camera world.

Reviews.Title: Substantial DSLR for less than $400
Reviews.Author: 68cuffs
Reviews.Content: I have just received this camera. My first impression is that it takes beautiful pictures. I mainlyuse it in the office, and take pictures indoors. The colours are vivid and clear. Focusing is somewhatslow and tedious. Once it decides to focus,  then it holds the picture and you don't get movement artefact.With my older 7 year old sony the focusing was a problem and often the photos were out of focus.I will post any negatives if I come across it. I give it 5 stars on initial impression. Hopefully i don't have to change my mind.

Reviews.Title: Perfect. LOVE my new camera!
Reviews.Author: Giancarlos K.
Reviews.Content: I got what I asked for plus super fast shipping. I recommend this camera to those of you who love photography. Photos come out great, and the macro shots are just perfect!

Reviews.Title: THE BEST.
Reviews.Author: AceOfSpades
Reviews.Content: This camera is SLICK. I absolutely love it. Perfect camera to learn on. Refurbished is definitely a good way to go. Just like new but cheaper.

Reviews.Title: Perfect starter DSLR camera
Reviews.Author: Carroll
Reviews.Content: I wanted to upgrade from a point and shoot.  Purchased this right before going on a weeklong vacation.  Tried it out for about a week before we left so I would know how to use it.  Very easy in the automatic mode.  I took great shots all during our vacation.  Now I would like to learn how to do more with the manual features, but I know I can always get good shots with automatic mode.  Like having a point and shoot, but with much better results!  Recommend getting a telephoto lens too.

Reviews.Title: Good extra camera
Reviews.Author: C. Engbrock "Hop Bunny 789"
Reviews.Content: Bought this for everyday use by our staff. We've been using Canon equipment for decades and while NIkon has good stuff we like Canon because of the investment we have in lenses.For the price, this is great for semi-professional photographers to get quality shots for use in our publications.

Reviews.Title: Camera
Reviews.Author: Nina "Samantha"
Reviews.Content: I am glad I purchased this.  The pictures are excellent. I am still learning the different categories as I continue to use the camera.

Reviews.Title: Nice camera
Reviews.Author: Jeremy Forgey
Reviews.Content: Very nice camera. It is my first dslr. Excellent price and very easy to use. Pictures are very good quality.

Reviews.Title: Excellent purchase
Reviews.Author: Carlos Perez
Reviews.Content: Extra oridanary digital camera, very functional and high quality!Wide range of accessories for better performance!I highly recommend the purchase

Reviews.Title: Excellent entry level camera, great price
Reviews.Author: JCR Giraldo "ibmjuank"
Reviews.Content: I did lots of research before buying a camera. Read lots of reviews and one conclusion I had was that no matter which entry level DSLR camera, one can't go wrong, since all have 4+ stars reviews.I bought this one, who is supposedly one of the lower level DSLR. But I can tell you it takes wonderful pictures, even if you don't have lots of experience with cameras. Without even looking to the manual, I took nice shots right away, that impressed my friends and family.So far have use it for portraits of my little ones and landscape. I also got a Telephoto Lens, although haven't use it yet (haven't had the need).After reading reviews, I thought in buying an extra Flash, but the built-in with the camera is really good. At least far better than the one you find in a regular digital camera (non-DSLR).

Reviews.Title: Loved the Product!!!!!
Reviews.Author: marie evans
Reviews.Content: I got the package way ahead of schedule.  I just received it on Thursday and not Monday as expected.  I was pleased to see everything was in the package I bought at the price of the camera.  The shipper was excellent in sending it ahead of schedule.  Keep up the good work!  I got this camera just in time for school for Monday.I would recommend this seller and also I would recommend this product as well.Marie

Reviews.Title: excellent pictures
Reviews.Author: Toyzone
Reviews.Content: I will happily recommend this camera to anyone who wants professional photos, without any technical procedures, this camera is easy to use and is a great value for the price. Just remember to get a memory card so you can use it right away!

Reviews.Title: It will take more practice-but I won't cut off heads in my photos.
Reviews.Author: sandra n phillips
Reviews.Content: I was able to get nice photos right away-first attempt to use the camera .The camera took good pics of nighttime in a snowstorm and snow ball fight. The trip was one to take "precious non-replaceable photos" of our 4 yr old grandson and his encounters with Santa's Elf, breakfast with Santa, the wonderful sleigh ride in a one horse open sleigh- plus SNOW !!!

Reviews.Title: This thing rocks
Reviews.Author: TechGeek
Reviews.Content: Price, performance, quality.  You can't miss with this.  The best DSLR available in my opinion.  Canon knows cameras.  You'll need lenses but that's the whole point of DSLR

Reviews.Title: Good timing and good product
Reviews.Author: Cammie Marler
Reviews.Content: The product came in the amount of time it was supposed to and it is in great shape! I have nothing to complain about.

Reviews.Title: Very Satisfied
Reviews.Author: Dobro1024
Reviews.Content: I am an amateur photographer, the Cannon Rebel T3 is my first SLR camera.  I have had the T3 about 4 weeks and have had no issues with it.  I have found the T3 to take stunning images, especially of people (indoor and outdoor), in automatic mode.  The controls and menu are easy to navigate.  The autofocus and image stabilization features work great.  I am very pleased with my purchase of the T3 and recommend it to anyone looking to cross over from a point and shoot camera to an SLR.

Reviews.Title: Good deal
Reviews.Author: M. Corwin
Reviews.Content: Really enjoying this camera, still learning!  Hope to publish a book soon with holiday pics just after purchase.  Good Choice.

Reviews.Title: Camera
Reviews.Author: Rob Martin
Reviews.Content: I love this camera.  Since I have only owned in the past small and unsophisicated cameras, I am so impressed with the Canon.  I have taken some great pictures during the holiday season.  The only issue I have had thus far is the zoom on the camera.  It does not zoom in that great.  I know I probably can get an attachment to zoom in more.  I also was disappointed that the camera did not come with a bag.  It cost a lot and that would have been great.  It is my fault for not looking for those type of deals since I saw them after I had ordered this camera.  Other than that, I have heard great things about Canon and I am happy with this purchase.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Jess Cuellar
Reviews.Content: Camera does everything it's supposed to do.  Have had some great times with it.  Spent last weekend using it and took some excellent shots.

Reviews.Title: Great Entry Level to Advanced camera...
Reviews.Author: GES-MTB 29
Reviews.Content: Canon...what more needs to be said. This is a great camera if you're just getting started or if you are making the move to digital. Great quality and value...I bought this one as a gift and as expected...Loved it!

Reviews.Title: nice
Reviews.Author: mary williams
Reviews.Content: I got the camera for my own Christmas present. Love it. But, I also ordered the telephoto lense, and did not get it. Amazon cancelled my order. Wth!!! I wanted both, and it was such a great price. Was very unhappy with the cancellation of my lense.

Reviews.Title: Canon EOS Rebel T3 12.2 MP CMOS digital slr with 18-55mm is ii lens
Reviews.Author: Earlene McGuire
Reviews.Content: Low tech,not top of the line in technology, top of the line is too expensive for me to consider purchasing.I like the quality of Canon lenses, it did meet the expectations I was expecting.

Reviews.Title: Great Gift for Photography Buffs
Reviews.Author: Elizabeth Goldman
Reviews.Content: This was a gift requested by a family member who is into photography.  It is easy to use and gives great results.

Reviews.Title: "Also Bought" Correction
Reviews.Author: flyin_mac
Reviews.Content: Though I am just learning to use the camera I am fully convinced that it is a superior product.NOTE, however that the web page images of items "Also Bought" incorrectly includes a 55mm (diameter) Tiffen UV Protection Filter. This is not the correct size for 18-55mm focal length lens! You need 58mm filter size for this lens and also for the 55-250mm focal length lens. This misleading situation lead to misordering 55mm UV and Polarizing filters that had to be returned. Since these were gifts, the distant buyer will get a refund, or replacement filters(?) instead of sending replacements to me. I think filter size should be shown next to the camera to assure that buyers order the correct accessories, 58mm here. I do not know whether this problem repeats on other camera models.

Reviews.Title: great for shaky people
Reviews.Author: Mona Jacob "lakajunlady"
Reviews.Content: I used to love taking pictures with a point and shot but shook too much for a clear picture. THIS camera took care of the problem.. I used to use a pentax K1000 and loved it but wanted a DSLR  very worth the money

Reviews.Title: A great camera
Reviews.Author: Fvargas
Reviews.Content: This camara is awesome! it take really good pictures, now i only need a good case that feeds in this camera!

Reviews.Title: My 1st SLR and I love it
Reviews.Author: chelleg96761
Reviews.Content: Still lots to learn, but so far well worth it. We took a hundred pictures the 1st day we got it!

Reviews.Title: Canon has it figured out
Reviews.Author: Walker
Reviews.Content: Great cameraTake some time to get around the camera. It does all as far as pictures are concerned. Very pleased

Reviews.Title: Canon EOS Rebel T3 12.2 MP CMOS Digital SLR with 18-55mm IS II Lens
Reviews.Author: Back Country Geezer
Reviews.Content: My rating is actually more like 4.55 stars.  Other than the light weight (which emphasizes shake), this camera is absolutely perfect for both beginners and intermediate photographers (or amatuers who like sharp, luxuriant photos without having to take a 4 year college course to get them!).  I've been a lover of great images for over 35 years and am very happy with this product.

Reviews.Title: Perfect Christmas Gift!
Reviews.Author: Mihalis P. "Mihalis the Greek"
Reviews.Content: I purchased this as a gift for someone who wanted a DSLR camera. For the price, the quality is wonderful and the pictures are fantastic! It is not a bulky camera, yet has a weight and grip that is useable by novice photographers. Of course, the brand name is quality as well!

Reviews.Title: Canon EOS Rebel T3 12.2 MP CMOS Digital SLR with 18-55mm IS II Lens
Reviews.Author: Ed Mullins
Reviews.Content: The Canon Rebel T3 is a fine beginner level DSLR camera. It has many features of higher end DSLRs, and is mainly lacking in Megapixels.

Reviews.Title: Great Christmas Gift!
Reviews.Author: Isabel Jeffares
Reviews.Content: The recipients loved the camera!  The only disappointment was that the price was substantially reduced shortly after I had already ordered and paid for it.

Reviews.Title: The best!
Reviews.Author: Bill
Reviews.Content: This was my entry level camera it was so easy to use on the one setting and as I explored the other setting on what they could do I was soon a novice and really enjoying my new passion and hobby.

Reviews.Title: another happy customer
Reviews.Author: patrick
Reviews.Content: this is a great camera with alot of functions to keep me pushung buttons for awhile. My wife loves taking pictures and this camera was at a great price for what it can do. I bought an accessory bundle with this and it has alot of good stuff to go with the camera. The camera may not be tp of the line but it is more than enough for the average photographer. I hope to get alot of years out of this one.

Reviews.Title: Snappy camera
Reviews.Author: Blondie0322
Reviews.Content: I've always loved snapping shots with my digital camera and I've recently been interested in diving into the world of DSLR. I've done a lot of research before my purchase, and I would have to say that I am incredibly satisfied. After tinkering with it for a a couple of hours i managed to find my way around and understand the settings. The images that I can now capture is incredible with this camera. I'm set on complete manual with this camera and shoot RAW, so I really don't bother with JPEG or Auto features. The video feature is decent but it does not sell the camera. If you're just jumping into photography this is a great start for anyone.  I had taken a digital camera class in college and help me explore more of the camera's options.  AAA++

Reviews.Title: Great camera, great price
Reviews.Author: oldgrizzly
Reviews.Content: This camera is everything that you could ask for from an even more expensive camera. It has great features and is easy to use. Unfortunately, it seems to be smarter than I am.

Reviews.Title: Awesome Gift
Reviews.Author: Slidersn
Reviews.Content: I bought this as a gift and this is one powerful camera especially with some simple lens and filter addons.  Out of the box useability and professional.

Reviews.Title: Great so far
Reviews.Author: Walc
Reviews.Content: Open the box, read the quick start and off you go. Very fast button to shutter click, flash pops up automatically and picture quality is outstanding. The  camera software installed on my computer easily and opens when you plug the camera in. Very clear questions appear asking you what you want to do with your pictures. Battery life is great. Love it!

Reviews.Title: It was a guft for my daughter and she loves it!
Reviews.Author: Gail
Reviews.Content: This is a Great camera at a good price.. You will need to but a standard size memory card to take pictures.

Reviews.Title: CANON EOS REEBEL T3
Reviews.Author: Elena Aramburu
Reviews.Content: I'ts exactly what I wanted, so I'm very happy with my new camera. Was a gift for Christmas from my husband.

Reviews.Title: Great camera

Reviews.Content: I got this as a moving gift when my husband got military orders to move from coast to coast, I love it!  I love how fast it is, I've caught amazing photos with this :-) great for the price.

Reviews.Title: Great
Reviews.Author: Happy
Reviews.Content: Nice camera, awesome pics. Easy to use for a beginner like me, transferring from a point and shoot. Thank you!!

Reviews.Title: America's most popular camera!
Reviews.Author: Thomas B. Cooper "Bohmeister"
Reviews.Content: Wow! For a non pro enthusiast this camera is amazing. Takes beautiful shots easily and fairly easy to figure out without having constantly to consult the manual. It has renewed my love for photography. And I must admit, after seeing the Agassi commercials in the 90's, I've wanted a Rebel for a long time. Great product, wonderful price.

Reviews.Title: Great!
Reviews.Author: Kenneth C. Gunn
Reviews.Content: Just as advertised!!!  Great pictures and easy to use!  My 12 year old daughter uses it as well. Great buy!

Reviews.Title: 5 Stars from a Beginner
Reviews.Author: Gary A.
Reviews.Content: I'm not even going to begin to pretend that I could offer as much insight into this camera as some of the other reviewers here, but wanted to add my two cents.  This is an excellent camera for anyone looking to buy an entry level DLSR for family or hobby pictures, without putting a huge hole in your wallet.  The quality of these pictures may not compete with the higher end DSLRs, but is a significant step above point and shoot and for that matter micro four-thirds cameras.  In comparison, the pictures that you could take with this camera looka bsolutely stunning.  Oh, did I mention that this camera shoots excellent HD video, significantly above what is criminally sold as 720p or 1080p HD in the point and shoots.I purchased this camera from Amazon, along with a free 16GB SD card and a discount on the 55-250mm lens.  Based on the advice of others, avoid the 75-300mm lens thats being offered through this same discount deal, as the 55-250mm lens is vastly superior.Overall, this is an excellent beginner's DSLR camera!

Reviews.Title: From a very novice POV
Reviews.Author: Stay at Home Dad
Reviews.Content: I have never owned a high end camera, little lone a DSLR. I had read review after review and decided to pick up this model and have to say it is amazing. It is the PERFECT beginners camera. The settings are easy to work with and learn, plus it designed for people like myself who want to take great photos while not going to head on into becoming a professional photographer. The lens is comes with is just a standard lens and upgrading in the future will most likely be a must but that is to be expected with a starter camera. It has a nice feel and the screen and view finder are crystal clear. If you want to get away from the point and click class but not got too crazy with the DSLR crowd.. this is the camera for you.

Reviews.Title: Canon EOS Rebel T3
Reviews.Author: George H. Smith
Reviews.Content: The Canon EOS Rebel T3 has met my expectations.  Took more than 100 pictures over a few days with excellent results.  The reviews were most helpful and accurate for this camera. For the money it was an excellent choice.

Reviews.Title: Good camera
Reviews.Author: Chris
Reviews.Content: Easy to operate and use. Good to have a spare battery as a backup. Takes great pictures and has all the attachments to make printing easy

Reviews.Title: Good Camera for Beginners to DSLRs
Reviews.Author: Southern Girl
Reviews.Content: I received the Rebel T3 as an early Christmas gift, and have been using it the past couple weeks. I am just getting into learning more about digital photography and the T3 is my first step into the world of DSLR camera. So far, I have been very impressed!I don't know all the of the settings just yet, but I like that the LCD screen gives me a little hint as to what each photo mode is used for. I also like the fact that I can use the viewfinder or the screen to take photos - coming from a history of cameras that used the LCD screen, this has helped me make the transition to using the viewfinder, as I can still use the screen when I want to.Battery life has been great - in the two weeks I have used it, I have yet to change or recharge the battery. The strap is a convenient accessory as well, though it's a little thick and doesn't feel all that comfortable on my neck.The Rebel T3 has given me the best photos I have ever snapped and I am excited to continue using and learning more about this camera. I picked up a copy of Canon Rebel T3 for Dummies, and it's been a huge help!

Reviews.Title: Camera
Reviews.Author: Hidi Schuyler
Reviews.Content: My son loves the camera! Great quality videos and pictures. Now I need to get him all the other lenses. Great Christmas present!!

Reviews.Title: A very good beginner DSLR
Reviews.Author: Lawrence Chu
Reviews.Content: This is my first DSLR. I must say that it is so user friendly!  The brief descriptions on the LCD screen corresponding to each function/setting help tremendously, and after only my 2nd week of using it, I already have a relatively strong command of the major settings of the camera (aperture, shutter speed, ISO, etc.) and can take quite decent manual shots (I hardly ever use the preset functions anymore), all in part due to the user-friendliness of all the functions and settings.  That being said, the presets are actually quite good, especially in daylight or well-lit scenes. In darker scenes, when the settings are manually set right, the quality of photos can be pristine.  This is a very powerful camera, and I do not regret for one instance not paying for the T3i or the T4/T4i, especially with this being my first DSLR.Perhaps one of the only gripes I have about the camera is that it lacks an audio input jack, so I have to depend on the built in mic for the audio in my videos (of course I can just record audio from a separate source and just sync the recording with the video later using editing software).So far, in addition to the camera, I have bought a SanDisk Ultra 16GB SDHC UHS-I Class 10 Memory Card, the PLR Optics High Resolution 3-piece Filter Set (very nice quality lens filters), and the Lowepro SlingShot 102 AW camera case, a very very good buy and highly recommended.  I am looking into buying a monopod now (there is a built in holder for a monopod on the Slingshot case), as well as a remote shutter release.Last point: My brother owns a Nikon D5100, and although he is not a professional photographer by any means, my photos have come out in a quality that has both impressed him and is on equal par with an average photo from his "higher class" camera.

Reviews.Title: Absolutely love this camera
Reviews.Author: Rowena Chambliss
Reviews.Content: Purchased this camera for my son and he loves it.  There is so much you are able to do with this camera and the price is hard to beat.  Very happy customer.

Reviews.Title: My first DSLR
Reviews.Author: Kelko
Reviews.Content: I'm loving this camera.  The quality of the pictures is very nice.  I'm currently reading Canon EOS Rebel T3/1100D for Dummies and would highly recommend it to first time owners since it goes into the specifics of this exact model and kit.  There are so many capabilities of this camera, and as a novice, I'm already getting some amazing shots.  A wonderful investment to preserve our family fun!!!

Reviews.Title: just what she wanted
Reviews.Author: dls
Reviews.Content: One great camera for one great price!  It will be easy add more accessories over time.  The clarity of the images is remarkable.

Reviews.Title: Love my T3
Reviews.Author: Yak
Reviews.Content: I love my T3. It's a great starter camera and 12 megapixels is all you really need. The lens options are limitless with this camera.Pros: Easy to use. Stable. Lots of lens options. "Well most SLR cameras the lens options are good" The manual is easy to read and Canon stands by their lenses and camera. The battery life is awesome. Went to Canada on vacation for a week and after 400 pictures I came home with over 80% of a charge. NO recharging needed.Cons: My camera only came with one lens. I have noticed some cameras with two starter lenses for the price I paid.Still I give this camera 5 stars for the quality. :)

Reviews.Title: SUPER!!!
Reviews.Author: Andres Palomar
Reviews.Content: It was a great bought, i recommend it totaly, I took beatiful photos, amazing quality and is so good looking

Reviews.Title: This was for my granddaughter and she loves it.
Reviews.Author: rita m winger
Reviews.Content: The camera is perfect in every way.  It takes wonderful pictures.  My granddaughter wants to get in photography and this is working good for her.  She is 13 and taking all kinds of pictures, mostly of animals.

Reviews.Title: Amazing quality :)
Reviews.Author: Grace Beale
Reviews.Content: I originally bought this camera just to practice until i could get a nicer one...but after using it for a week I was blown away! I took professional photos using a $400 camera! :) I will not be switching again for a long time...best camera I have ever used! Good job canon! I knew you could make a great entry-level DSLR camera! Don't even hesitate to buy this camera....you won't regret it! :)

Reviews.Title: Excellent SLR camera !
Reviews.Author: Mani
Reviews.Content: I got this camera yesterday.I had been longing to switch from a point and shoot camera to a DSLR.This camera is the best for guys like me with little knowledge on photography.Shoots fine shots right out of the box!!I am learning from a local photographer SLR cameras usage.I am going to update my review as I become well-versed with the multifunction of this fabulous camera.Go ahead and buy this camera.you will NEVER feel sorry

Reviews.Title: I have a...
Reviews.Author: Christie B. Park "momma1"
Reviews.Content: Canon sure shot and I have really like it, but, I felt it was time I tried a more professional digital camera. Several friendsmhavemvariations of the Canon Rebel...I actually have a film version of the camera that I love. I have it ready to use , but, I need to buy a GB card to store the memory...I didn't realize I needed that when I ordered the camera...just figured it came complete. Not a problem though...going to buy one tomorrow so I can take pictures of my daughter graduating from Virginia Tech on Friday!! Can't wait to use my early Christmas present!!

Reviews.Title: Canon EOS T3 12.2 MP
Reviews.Author: Ivan
Reviews.Content: Very good camera, perfect transition for a beginner from point and shoot digital camera to DSLR cameras. I'm happy with my purchase and the extras that came with from Amazon.

Reviews.Title: Pictures are great; video could work better
Reviews.Author: John F, Tech Enthusiast
Reviews.Content: This camera is exactly what most non-professional photographers want when they say they want an SLR camera. The pictures are great, and while the default settings for the camera make skin look a little odd, changing the light and ISO settings made the pictures look more like I am used to.I understand this product is not marketed to professionals, but I also wish the default wasn't so newbie-centered. It took a bit to get the camera the way I like it, and the automatic settings were pretty much on everything and sometimes got in the way.The video was the only thing I was disappointed with. It's much better than my cheaper $199 video camera, but:* It's hard to focus the video* The microphone picks up the noise turning the camera makes, which means (and I expected this, really) I'll have to record the sound with something else* The microphone distorts some soundAs the book in the packaging says, make sure you have a fast-writing 16G or more SD card if you plan on shooting video. I already possessed these since I do shoot a lot of video, but I thought I'd mention it to anyone interested.For most interested consumers, this camera is perfect. For anyone looking for a tool that takes great pictures and great video, don't expect a lot of control over the video feature, but expect great quality.

Reviews.Title: Love it
Reviews.Author: Austin's mom
Reviews.Content: Got this as an early Christmas present after years of getting aggravated with point and shoot cameras.  I have been wanting a professional camera that took better pictures and faster for years but never thought I could afford one.  A cousin of mine has one and I recently was over for a visit and was able to play around with hers and I loved it.  She has the T2i but the T3 was more in my budget and so far has not disappointed.  Pictures inside are a little darker than I would like but I think that has more to do with me still having to learn all the functions this camera and not a problem with the camera itself.  Through a deal on Amazon, I was able to also get the 55-250mm lens at a great price.  I love this lens and would recommend it to accompany this camera.  Highly recommended, and at a great price point, to anyone wanting to dive into DSLR from point and shoot cameras.

Reviews.Title: Great product, Great price!
Reviews.Author: Vania "mexican zebra"
Reviews.Content: As a graphic designer an illustrator I wanted a camera that was good enough so that I could take RAW pictures, but I didn't want to spend too much since I haven't had ANY digital cameras EVER. Also I wanted a camera that could make HD videos because I want to make some clips for animation. So I wanted to make a smart, prudent purchase. This was a used camera, but it seems practically brand new, and because of this I think I got it for a great price.

Reviews.Title: excellent camera , best I have ever owned.
Reviews.Author: Sandi Meyer Turner "sandimeyerthepainter"
Reviews.Content: I used the softwear to edit and improve photos I have already stored from my digital point and shoot cameras, and it cleaned them up really nice.  I am so happy with this camera AND the softwear that came with it; even for a truly novice photo taker, the instructions got me some great pictures.

Reviews.Title: Still experimenting
Reviews.Author: Kelsie
Reviews.Content: I am new to the dslr world! So I am still getting use to the basics and settings. I love what I can do with it this far tho! Pictures always look great!

Reviews.Title: Love my first DSLR camera!
Reviews.Author: Burberry_Love "chelle"
Reviews.Content: I love photography and I wanted to own a DSLR camera for the longest time ever! I didn't have a brand preference if it would be a Canon or a Nikon because price was my concern and both are quite expensive. Last weekend, Amazon posted a great deal on this DSLR camera $405 only plus I got free Transcend 16GB Class 10 SDHC Flash Memory Card (TS16GSDHC10E) and AmazonBasics Backpack for SLR Cameras and Accessories-Black. I didn't hesitate and grabbed the deal so now I got to explore my first DSLR camera. I am in love with it but I get frustrated when I try to use manual settings and I try to focus on a subject but the shutter won't go off. Oh well, I need to practice more.

Reviews.Title: Really nice camera for the price
Reviews.Author: AZ Gardener
Reviews.Content: I've been using this for almost a year now and I have to say it's a really nice camera. It's the only DSLR I've ever owned, so I can't compare it to others, but it really does what I want it to. It's easy to switch to manual and set up a perfect shot exactly how I want it to look.I've recently got into the HDR aspect of photography, and it's easy to do with this camera.  You can set the camera to take 3 consecutive shots at different exposures, then import into Photoshop's HDR feature, and it lets you tweak it to get the look you want.

Reviews.Title: A Great Camera for a Starter
Reviews.Author: Kimobob
Reviews.Content: I have always been interested in photography and have wanted to own a nice DSLR. This Camera was very intuitive to learn and use from a beginners standpoint. I use it frequently to take vacation photos, macro pictures of nature, and other fun shots. I really enjoyed the material that came in the box from Canon and the how the features were introduced in the manual. I am very to have found this DSLR and have no regrets with choosing this model to start with. If you are just starting out or are looking for a reliable shooter then this is definitely the one.

Reviews.Title: daughters baby
Reviews.Author: Hub1100
Reviews.Content: after 3 months of hard yearbook use, high school, it is operating flawlessly! she, and the camera, are inseparable and called on for important events.

Reviews.Title: 35MM to Digital SLR
Reviews.Author: IndyTP
Reviews.Content: Received my Canon EOS Rebel T3 about two weeks ago. I bought the kit with the EFS 18-55 lens & the EFS 55-250 zoom lens. Great camera, simple & fun to use especially for a novice. This camera is light weight but still feels solid even with the 55-250 lens attached.Wow is the T3 easy to just pick up & start shooting pictures. Excellence entry level DSLR camera for an amateur/novice photographer, good balance of ease of use, quality & price. Great purchase!This camera was rejuvenated my old photography hobby. Thanks Canon.

Reviews.Title: Love it.
Reviews.Author: Cathy
Reviews.Content: Easy to use, clarity is great. Not too heavy. Takes great pictures. Use the manual to learn more and get tips for better pictures.

Reviews.Title: Good SLR camera for beginners
Reviews.Author: Saba
Reviews.Content: This camera is great. It has a reasonable price yet with decent features. It is a great SLR camera for amateurs who are still starting to learn photography. Its functions are practical and simple.

Reviews.Title: GREAT CAMERA
Reviews.Author: larry h
Reviews.Content: I chose this camera for its user friendliness and ease of understanding. I am not a professional by no means but when I take pictures with this camera I believe I am and the shots are remarkable. I would recommend this camera for anyone that is out to get value and quality all in one. Great camera I love it.

Reviews.Title: excellent product and transaction

Reviews.Content: Product as described. No problems with transaction.  Would recommend using this amazon'er.  Would use this entity again for purchases. no complaints what so ever.

Reviews.Title: Great Deal
Reviews.Author: Fahad
Reviews.Content: It is a great Camera a highly recommended this camera for those people who want this camera as a first camera. Its worths every cent !AlSo the shipping was great and on time

Reviews.Title: Awesome!
Reviews.Author: majgoku
Reviews.Content: I'm really just a novice photographer (made so once we had our first baby girl) and I really love this camera. It's very easy to use and forgiving for any novice. I definitely recommend it to anyone!

Reviews.Title: Love it!
Reviews.Author: S. Fabius "BigBubs79"
Reviews.Content: Great camera period! I cant lie this camera has exceeded my expectation.  i cant wait to get the newer lenses so i can shoot more finer pics

Reviews.Title: love love love
Reviews.Author: K. Fishburn
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera because of the reviews on Amazon!!  I'm still learning it but I'm loving it.  I'm not a professional photographer.  I wanted it for my sons games.  Tired of the yellow pica from a regular point and shoot.  I can see this camera getting a lot of use.

Reviews.Title: Beginning Photography
Reviews.Author: D. Hallett "Fair Reader"
Reviews.Content: There are many, many great reviews on this product.  Mine will not be helpful or informative to advanced photographers, but maybe beginners will like it.The Canon Rebel T3 is a beautiful camera.  Straight from the box, it takes fantastic pictures that were no more difficult to set up than using a point-and-shoot camera.  This is a plus for me because I need to be able to take snapshots now while I learn all the intricacies of this type of photography.It has a lot of different shooting modes and a shake-stabilizer which is important to me since my hands aren't as steady as they used to be.If you're in the market for a new camera, and the point-and-shoot variety aren't what you need anymore, I strongly suggest this camera!  Read the other reviews and pick up a couple of books because you will need to know about both real photography and digital photography and post-picture editing.

Reviews.Title: Buying your first DSLR? Get this one.
Reviews.Author: Jake B.
Reviews.Content: As my first DSLR camera, this is an excellent choice. You can start out slow, using more automatic setting modes, but advance quickly to customizing every detail of every exposure.It feels very sturdy, and is much lighter than I anticipated (but that's not a bad thing). Nice hand-grip area, and everything feels comfortable in my larger-than-average hands. My wife, with much smaller hands, can also comfortably hold and handle it, able to access all necessary buttons and features while shooting.Overall it's a great camera. I'm pleased with the 18-55 kit lens, and plan to stick with this camera for 3-4 years while building my lens library and getting some shooting experience.

Reviews.Title: Wonderful Camera!
Reviews.Author: SeeRayMoo
Reviews.Content: There's nothing more really to say than what I stated in my review title. It's a great camera, not very heavy and is easily transportable. Takes wonderful pictures and videos. The only complaint I would have is that the accessories for this bad boy are so expensive!

Reviews.Title: Excellent Camera
Reviews.Author: P. Goodman
Reviews.Content: I had used a few point and shoot cameras before, but I felt like getting into DSLR's. And good thing I chose this camera. Works like a charm. The auto moodes are great for first time photographers, and the manual mode is not as intimidating as other cameras. So if you are just getting into photography, it's a great price and an excellent camera.

Reviews.Title: Canon quality never disappoints
Reviews.Author: Michael A. Linneer
Reviews.Content: I got this to replace my aging Canon Digital 300D 6.5Mp. The 1100D has 12.5 Mp and is faster than the old 300D. The controls are easier and give faster access to ISO and aperture settings. Works beautifully with my existing EOS AF lenses. You can't go wrong with Canon!

Reviews.Title: wonderful
Reviews.Author: skuddle
Reviews.Content: this camera has opened up a whole new world  of photography,  I had a cloudshot scene on my up one my screen,  a friend was over and until i told her different,  she thought it was a commercial  image wall paper.there is a bit of a learning curve,  but once you actually start using it,  it is great.  i got the canon rebel for dummies book and that has bee a great teacher to my camera

Reviews.Title: Favorite camera so far!
Reviews.Author: KMiller86
Reviews.Content: This is by far my favorite camera. It is wonderful quality and fit within my budget. I love the quality of the photos I have gotten so far. I wish I could have afforded a longer lens but the kit lens (18-55mm) is sufficient for now.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera!!
Reviews.Author: KJ
Reviews.Content: This is my first SLR camera and I REALLY like it!  It's easy to use, the battery lasted for 600+ pictures in the first 2 months I had it and the sports option does a nice job.  Not all the sports motion pictures are clear, but I almost always get a couple nice shots from it.  I am totally enjoying this camera and would recommend it to anyone for their first SLR.

Reviews.Title: My pictures were pathetic . . . .
Reviews.Author: Rachel Serrano "Racheybug"
Reviews.Content: . . . . until my husband took pity on me and bought me this camera for Christmas.  Out of the box, I was amazed at how much better the pictures were, without even beginning to experiment with settings.  I began doing research on using the settings in the exposure triangle to have more creative control over the pictures, and will read anything I can get my hands on.  I really enjoy this camera, it is simple to use and will produce great pictures in auto mode.  If you want to have more fun, become familiar with the creative modes (it can be confusing to keep straight at first, but just keep practicing!).  One point of caution, you will want to spend more money!  As you become better at taking pictures, you'll want to add things like new lenses, flashes, tripod, color gels, the list goes on and on. Reviews.Title: great dsrl starter camera
Reviews.Author: blh
Reviews.Content: I purchased the Canon EOS Rebel DSLR camera a month ago and I absolutely love it. The main reason I wanted this camera was to take sporting pictures of my cousins kids, I needed something that wouldn't blur where its not perfect its 10 x's better than my old digital camera. The lighting has alot to do with it. I have noticed that if the lighting is not good then don't use the sports setting, use the manual setting it uses the flash and takes good pictures. Non sports pictures I have taken have been awesome, the pictures are so fine, shiny and life like. I have not purchased the additional lens yet, right now its not needed. I charged the battery in only 2 hours and it lasted 3 weeks. I highly recommend this camera.

Reviews.Title: Great DSLR
Reviews.Author: Brandon
Reviews.Content: As my first DSLR, I am loving this camera. I moved up from a Nikon S3000 point and shoot (which takes good photos for a point and shoot), and was going to move to the D3100 but decided on the T3 because of its Auto Exposure Bracketing feature (a must have if you want to take HDR)and cheaper price. The camera is very easy to use and has great image quality. There is a nice built in guide that tells you what each setting is so that you will never have to google it. It also has good quality video (720p at 30fps or 25fps). It has a HDMI out for connecting to TVs and such. RAW files work great with Lightroom 3, though noise can been seen on the images even at low ISOs (which Lightroom can take care of). Focus range on the kit lens is 0.8ft, but you can focus on a subject and then use the zoom to get in closer, giving you a macro like image. Overall very happy with this camera. Got a great price on it here at Amazon ($450, no tax, free two day shipping :)Would definitely recommend to someone else. Going to upload photos here on the product page as soon as I can.

Reviews.Title: Camera worked great...for 20 days!!!
Reviews.Author: Benjamin F.
Reviews.Content: This is my first review so bear with me.I bought the T3 Canon for an art class in school.  The teacher recommended it because it was Canons cheapest model.  Well now I know why.  When I received my T3 I was very excited.  That was on the 7th of January.  I took many(about 40) pictures and all came out stunning.  The T3 DOES take great photos.  My problems arose 20 days later.  Now I don't doubt that the countless people who gave this camera 5 stars had a great time with the T3.  I'm just telling you my experience.  (NOTE:  This is not a review about button layout, "feel" of the camera or it's automatic mode.  I am not new to DSLR cameras.)I had put off an assignment for school that was due the next day.  So, I finally mustered up all my will to complete the assignment.  I took out the camera( to make clear, I had not dropped the camera in mud or concrete or sand, or water) and took a picture.  I looked to the display screen to see my photo, only, there was no photo.  But there was a message saying "err 30 turn off and on replace battery".  So I did those things and it still came up with the same message.  I went to the internet for any help.  Apparently an err 30 is quite common with the 7D Canon, but not so much with the T3.  It has something to do with the shutter.  One post I read was that the shutter is rated for 18,000 shots or something like that.  I had shot maybe 70 photos before this happened. In short, there is no DIY way to fix this problem.  It has to go to Canon to be fixed.  I would not be so upset if the T3 had a lifetime warranty, but it doesn't, it has only a one year warranty.  So if this happens again a year later, I have to pay to get it fixed when it is Canon's faulty product that is giving me problems.If you buy this product and it works for you, then great.  I used the Canon cameras in high school and never had any problems. I absolutely loved it.  But, if it doesn't, you may regret it, so beware, and buy at your own risk.

Aside from the Canon vs Nikon control layout and other philosophical differences, there's no reason to complain.If you're like many people, who see video as a big selling point of modern DSLRs, skip this one and get a newer model.  The only way you can do video on this is if the camera and target are stationary.  No real auto-focus on video.  Works for what I'm doing, but probably won't for many.

Reviews.Title: Canon T3 is a Great 1st DSLR
Reviews.Author: Computer Guy
Reviews.Content: I have been using this camera for a little over a month now.  Have taken close to 800 photos and have not had any issues at all.  Like most others this is my first DSLR camera and moving up from a point and shoot camera.  I browsed the instructions and have been looking up info on the internet on how to take better photo's (especially indoors at my kid's concerts in dark auditoriums).  Higher ISO photos turn out well with minimal pixilation.  I have ended up with some sharp, well lit indoor photos that are the best I have ever taken.  The full auto mode works well in most situations, however trying to broaden my skills and trying other modes. I really like the aperture priority mode when taking portrait type photos of my kids (slightly blurred background really brings out your subject).  The continuous shot mode works well for a camera in this price range. I have also been able to take some nice "stop action" shots playing around with the shutter speed.  This kit lens works great, however already looking into a lens that offers a better zoom. In the end the Canon T3 is a great "starter" DSLR camera for under $500.  I would not hesitate to recommend to family or friends.

Reviews.Title: Red Eye Redux Removal
Reviews.Author: Sky King "Sky King"
Reviews.Content: This is a great little camera except for one thing: No sync cord connection!  In the 1970's we learned how to remove red eye: Get the flash off the camera.  If the flash is away from the lens the chances of red eye are greatly diminished. This camera has a built in flash, but no sync cord connection for a flash on a bracket. The built in flash works well and gives good pix, but red eye is a problem. Using a flash on a bracket or off camera solves this problem. Without a sync cord connection you can't connect a flash. SOLUTION: A hot shoe adapter can be attached to the hot shoe. The hot shoe adapter has a sync cord connection to attach another flash. Hook up a flash on a bracket, plug it into the sync cord connection and you get great flash photos with no red eye!  Set the camera to M for Manual and set the shutter speed to 1/60 and the aperature to F 5.6.  Set these same settings on an automatic flash and you are in business.  Enjoy!Update: The 1/60, F 5.6 @ 200 ISO. Is not a good balance. The flash is too over powering. I like mostly available light with a little fill in flash. To get a better balance meter the available light and then adjust the flash to provide a little fill in.  It takes a little trial and error to get it right, but once you get it, the results are very good. Another option is to bounce the light off the ceiling for even more difused light. Good luck!

Reviews.Title: Amazing Camcorder, If I could rate it 6 stars I would
Reviews.Author: dreamscape115
Reviews.Content: I was wondering if I should get the T3 or T3i, I decided I didn't need billboard quality and didn't take a whole lot of video from the camera since I also have a Canon Camcorder so I decided to get a T3 and boy am I glad.  My buddy has a T3i and we compared them...NO DIFFERENCE, other than slightly more megapixels on his but that only means you can zoom into somoene's nose hair instead of their nose when editing and I don't really need that.  I use it about 3 or 4 times a week. I will try and get some pics up from it.  This camera does phenomenal at night which is always everyone's worry. The controls are simple although Creative Auto Confused me a little bit at first but if you hit the "Q" button towards the top right side of the LCD screen you can change settings, with regards to that I usually Keep It in "Vivid", "Intense" or "warm" for deep colors.  I took pictures in cloudy weather in "Vivid" and "Warm" and it looks like a nice sunny day. the ONLY problem I have is I did try the video feature and the videos cam out malfunctioning but it may also be my computer because they are fine when I view them on the camera.  I strongly recommend this to anyone that is transitioning from point & Shoot or beginning a photography career.  I also recommend this to Hobbiest photographers that do photography in their spare time like me.

Reviews.Content: I literally JUST got this camera in today.  I didn't purchase it from Amazon sadly because, well long story short, I decided to refresh my browser before check out to see the price had gone up $20, oh well.  I still can leave my current thoughts after an hour of playing around with it.  I am a newbie, this is actually my first personal digital camera, I am only 18 and decided to splurge for a nice Canon DSLR my mother wasn't too happy about me buying.First off, It really would be nice if it came with some type of even marginal SD card. I did order that off of Amazon but it still hasn't come so I had to settle for the one in my Dad's camcorder for now.  The instructions are alright, skimming through but, for instance, the 'attaching and detaching section' doesn't say how to detach and since I am still new at this, it took me a few minutes to realize what that side button next to the lense was for.I am still really new at this but the live view mode is a really big hassle for me as well.  It is easier just using the view-finder to take the pics instead of seeing them on the screen because it shoots faster.  My newbie ways aren't helping me in that front.Overall though, this camera is fantastic.  It looks good, a bit scary at first when you see all those buttons if it is your first camera but once you get the hang of it, you will have a blast.  Since I still JUST got it, I will most likely update this review at some point.

Reviews.Title: Buyers beware
Reviews.Author: Carla
Reviews.Content: I ordered this camera from Amazon.com, was pleased with its function up to the 2nd week of use. After taking a picture at a function the following message appeared on the screen: "Err30 shooting is not possible due to an error. Turn the camera off and on again or re-install the battery" This was tried several times however the camera still does not work. Since it was purchased on-line and shipped overseas the warranty is not valid "Canada and USA ONLY". I am so disappointed, I almost cried. Nevertheless, I am trying to see if the camera can be repaired. This is not the first camera I purchased on line. After checking the internet there seems to be a lot of other people (worldwide) with the same problem with Canon Cameras. EXTREMELY DISAPPOINTED.

Reviews.Title: LOVE!
Reviews.Author: John
Reviews.Content: I just bought this camera saturday and got free shipping. It was scheduled to arrive in 5-9 days, but it came in 2! In other words, the shipping was awesome. I have been using digital cameras my whole life, but I am already starting to figure out the T3. The pictures are incredibly crisp and it works alright with zoom as well (using the included lens). I love the creative auto setting (CA). The only downfall is the fact that if it has a way to crop photos ON the camera, I haven't found it yet. Other than that, I'm in love!

Reviews.Title: Great value entry level DSLR
Reviews.Author: mokcl

Reviews.Title: LOVE IS IN THE AIR!!!! NOW THAT I HAVE MY BABY! LOL!
Reviews.Author: Dassa Marie
Reviews.Content: OKAY, FIRST I WOULD LIKE TO SAY THAT I LOVE, LOVE, LOVE THIS CAMERA!!!! I'M NOT A PROFESSIONAL PHOTOGRAPHER BUT I DO SOME FREE LANCE PHOTOGRAPY AND I'VE BEEN DOING IT FOR A WHILE NOW AND IT'S GREAT!!!! WHAT I LOVE ABOUT THE T3 IS THE BODY!!! IT FEELS LIGHT WEIGHT AND IT'S SMALLER THEN MOST BODIES! NOT SO HEAVY ON THE WRIST WHEN YOUR DOING HOUR LONG SHOOTS, ETC! IF YOUR A MARCO PHOTOGRAPHER THEN YOU WOULD MOST DEF. HAVE TO PURCHASE A EXTENDER LENS(IF YOUR ON A BUDGET YOU CAN FIND ONE ON AMAZON FOR UNDER 11 BUCKS)IT MAKES FOR A BETTER PICTURE! YOU REALLY JUST HAVE TO TAKE SOME TIME AND LEARN WHAT YOUR "BABY" CAN DO! AND THAT'S WITH ANY CAMERA!!! BUT IT'S JUST SO EASY TO USE!!! THE MANUAL BREAKS IT DOWN CLEARY.NOW AS FAR AS THE MOVIE MODE IF YOUR LOOKING TO SHOOT MUSIC VIDEO'S OR SOMETHING OF THE SORT I WOULD CONSIDER THE T2I OR THE T31 BOTH HAVE 1080 HD QUALITY AS THE T3 HAS A 740 HD BUT IT GETS THE JOB DONE!!!! IT WORKS LIKE MAGIC WITH A LED LIGHT OF ANY SORT!!!WITH MY "BABY" I PURCHASED THE FOLLOWING: TT50 FLASH SPEEDLITE (WORKS GREAT BY THE WAY) YOU CAN BUY THAT ON AMAZON IF YOUR ON A LOW BUDGET! Reviews.Title: Money down the drain
Reviews.Author: Henry M. Millstein
Reviews.Content: I admit that this camera took fine photos—while it lasted. A year and a half after we purchased it, the flash ceased to pop up. It was out of warranty, so we had to pay over $200 to Canon to have it fixed. Then, about nine months after we got it back, the camera ceased to function altogether; it would not turn on. Since the warranty on repairs is only six months, it would cost us at least another $200 to have it repaired again. I'm reluctant to pour more money down this drain. Canon has a good reputation, and its products should not be this unreliable.

Reviews.Content: I have nothing but good things to say. Shooting in raw definitely changes the way your pictures look. This camera helped me get out of just shooting with a point and shoot. Looking Forward to catching so many good shots as I grow more with this camera.

Reviews.Content: Being my first camera, I wasn't sure what specs were needed or what to look for.outside of the little Kodak "point and shoot". It's small enough to carry around quickly, but not small enough to be a "basic camera".

Reviews.Title: He loves it!

Reviews.Content: This camera was a birthday gift for my husband.  He has had it on his wish list for a while.

Reviews.Title: Super nice big camera please
Reviews.Author: WAYNE CARTER
Reviews.Content: My wife wanted "one of those super nice big cameras"  she didn't know why or how to use, or anything, but it's what she wanted.I bought her this bottom of the barrel model as she's really the point and shoot type.She LOVES it, finds it easy to use and has been pleased. Reviews.Title: Great Cam!
Reviews.Author: Michael Nickles "Michael"
Reviews.Content: Great little cam when paired with the right lenses. It's decent in low light. Some say don't go above 800 iso but its completely fine at 1600 or 3200. Yes you'll see noise but the picture is still decent and isn't horrible. I use a Tamron 28-75mm 2.8 lens with this and get really nice pictures, though I should have gotten the 17-50 2.8 since this is not a full frame camera. Works really well with a canon 40mm 2.8 pancake lens as well. A lot better than the 18-55 kit lens. The UI is easy to use. Screen is good, viewfinder is good, build quality is nice.This is a great camera if you are someone who wants a camera that's better than a point and shoot but don't see yourself needing something high end.I believe if you see yourself wanting to start photography as a serious hobby though, you'd be better off buying a Rebel T3i body with a 50mm 1.8 or a 40mm 2.8 as a starter cam. You'd only be spending a little more for that combo if you searched the right sites, and you'd get better results with higher resolution and more features.All in all though, it's a great camera for the crowd it's aimed at. If this is your very first DSLR, you won't be disappointed!

Reviews.Content: I stalked this camera for 3 months before I bought it! Reviews.Title: excellent

Reviews.Title: Good Value

Reviews.Content: This is a great camera for a beginner or advanced photographer.  great pics and easy to use.  Lots of modes and options, but the automatic mode is great and the pics come out beautiful.  must buy

Reviews.Title: I couldn't stress this enough: THIS CAMERA IS AWESOME!
Reviews.Author: Rimsha Malik
Reviews.Content: Personally, I have a passion for photography. I'm not trying to get a really high quality a camera and if you're getting a camera for the first time, I think this is perfect. I'm actually planning on buying this one because one of my friends has it. She allowed me to try it and I took a few pictures and got the hang of it in around 10 minutes.I'm a newbie and I guess that means that you probably won't pay as much attention to this review. But, trust me, this camera is beyond amazing in every way possible. It's easy, smart, and it makes all your photos look professional. I especially like the high definition and perfection it brings to every picture.A lot of people might say it's a bad camera because of a few bad experiences. I have used this camera few times and I have never had a complaint. You just have to give it a few minutes and explore the menu, the settings, and try it out on a few random things before you can actually take it out and start using it for events and other activities.Most people probably don't know how to set the camera for certain indoor and outdoor conditions such as darkness, bright lighting, dim lighting, close shots, far shots, landscapes, etc. I think that's the main reason people might complain about this camera.Don't get me wrong, I am no expert when it comes to photography. I'm just starting off, But, honestly, as much as i have used this camera, this camera is heaven to any beginner.Additional notes:Check out the buttons. Easy navigation right at your fingertips :DI couldn't stress this enough: THIS CAMERA IS AWESOME!

Reviews.Title: this camera is inspirational
Reviews.Author: Jude
Reviews.Content: This is my first SLR style camera. I have always been a photo enthusiast but could never afford a higher end camera. I found myself taking great pictures on the creative automatic mode right out of the box. I have a lot to learn on how this camera works and how I can manually set it for more personalized photos. I purchased the Canon EOS Rebel T3 for Dummies book on Amazon; and I must say this book is a must because the included manual for the camera is pretty much worthless. I think this camera is worth its weight in pictures. The battery life is holding well. The lens it comes with is great for most all indoor shots; however, the zoom lens (which is sold separately) is really needed for outdoor shots. Sometimes you can find "bundle packages" where you get an awesome deal with camera, extra zoom lens, case and memory card. You just have to look around for it. I found a bundle deal... it's the best.

Reviews.Title: Very Impressed
Reviews.Author: Henrik E. Hansen
Reviews.Content: I have been a dedicated amateur photographer for over 40 years.  I shoot with a 5D, MK2 and all "L" glass.  My wife loves to take snap shots but the 5D "tank" is too much for her so I decided on the T3. It's light weight, small and very easy to use.  The live view is a big plus and I like the fact that all my lenses and flash are compatible. I must admit that although the results aren't in the same league with the 5D, I'm blown away with the quality, even with the consumer grade lens.  This is an entry level camera, but Canon has done a remarkable job with it.  However, I must admit it looks a little strange with a 70-200mm L lens on the front!Henrik Hansen, DDS

Reviews.Title: This is not a "for video" DSLR folks...

Reviews.Title: Open Your Eyes!
Reviews.Author: S. Normand "Scotcher"
Reviews.Content: It is easy to get tunnel vision with all these glowing reviews on Amazon.  However, this camera really doesn't have any standout features.  Its the same old technology that has been around for years.  You are still going to have to wait a ton of time between shots, the burst mode is slow, and the burst mode does not support focusing between shots.  The view finder is not going to actually show you the picture you are going to get since it is an optical viewfinder.  And the viewfinder is going to black out when you actually take the shot.  Sure, all these traditional SLR cameras take great pictures, but really, what camera at this price doesn't.  What are you really looking for at this price point?  For me, it is fast between shots and can burst fast so I am sure to get a great shot.  I hate cameras that make me wait between shots until the camera is ready to take another picture.If you want the hidden gem in the SLR camera world, check out the Sony SLT technology.  It is a new technology that is much faster and allows the viewfinder and focus mechanisms to function like they should.  I have the SLT-A57 and I think you can tell from the reviews that it is as good or better than any of these SLR cameras.No, I don't work for Sony.  I just think that someone should point out the fact that there are other options out there and better technology available.

Reviews.Title: Better than a point and shoot, but still...
Reviews.Author: Lauren
Reviews.Content: I really wanted to love this camera. After deciding that our Panasonic point and shoot just wasn't cutting it and deciding to purchase a new camera for our overseas trip, we did quite a bit of research into what camera would suit us. Obviously we weren't looking to take professional shots, but we wanted a camera relatively easy to use that would take clear, bright photos. We settled on this model having read countless positive reviews, knowing it was entry level into the DSLR world, and were looking forward to seeing the difference in picture quality.The noticable difference in this camera is when taking indoor shots, they are infinitely better than a point and shoot in terms of picture clarity. I have so far been disappointed, however, in the outdoor shots it takes. They are no better than my P&S; and the autofocus is terrible, so many of the photos come out soft and focused in the wrong areas. I will need to learn how to manually focus and see if this helps. The landscape setting is also disappointing as most of the photos also come out a little soft.When researching DSLRs it was pointed out that what you see in the viewfinder is ultimately the photo you get. I have not found this at all, quite often the zoom will pop up when I am autofocusing and then not flash when I take a picture? So the photo is much darker than what is in the viewfinder.There is very little zoom on the kit lens, when you are zoomed right in it's the same as if you were looking at the subject with your own eyes. Zooming out allows more to be included in your shot. We did not pay extra for the zoom kit lens and I don't regret it as I fear this may be the same quality as the one we have, even if it is able to zoom in more. As I learn more about DSLRs I may purchase a better quality lens and see if this helps.I must mention that thus far, we have mainly been taking photos on the auto setting while we learn more about the other functions. I do understand that the quality of the shots ultimately relies on the talent of the photographer (or lack thereof!) Perhaps with a bit more knowledge and experience we will see an improvement in our photos. For now, I advise people that you get what you pay for and if you truly want awesome shots you may have to fork out a little more for a better lens (and/or camera body) and photography lessons!

All the basic (and not so basic) manual controls, plus an option to take decent video (minus external microphone or many options).It worked fine for me for exactly one month, but now every time I try to take a picture I get "Err 30", which apparently means the shutter mechanism is toast.  We'll see how they do on doing a warranty repair, but it's disappointing that after such a short amount of usage there is a basic mechanism failure like that.  I'd say over that time I've taken maybe 300-400 pictures, and all in a nice controlled studio setting.Meanwhile, my Sony Alpha which I've had for quite a few years now continues to perform like a champ.

I make book covers with Photoshop and use pictures in some covers. If you want to tell how it will look when printed you have to look at it in "actual pixels." If you look at it the photo in 50% magnification it will look better than what it really is.When I took pictures with a 35mm camera, I learned in a class to use a 10x magnifying glass to see if the slides were clear or not. So I know what clear is, and this camera does NOT take clear pictures.Out of dozens of pictures, I got two that were almost clear and when I used the "sharpen edges" feature those two did get clear. But most photos are bad. So I RETURNED THIS CAMERA.I have a pocket camera by Panasonic that takes better pictures than this thing.
