Reviews.Title: Too Big And Bulky
Reviews.Author: Linda Cargill "suspense gal"
Reviews.Content: I got this Canon Rebel camera for Christmas and returned it after about a week. I was accustomed to using a Leica digital non-SLR camera for my travels and my everyday needs. The best thing about the Leica was the fact that it fit into my pocket and was available at a moment'Leica V-LUX 20 12.1 MP Digital Camera with 12x Wide Angle Optical Zoom and 3.0-Inch LCDs notice to take pictures wherever they presented themselves. And many of the pictures I take seem to occur suddenly such as a roadrunner appearing in front of my car or a sunset right before the sun goes down. I wouldn't have time to run back to the house and get out my bigger camera.The Canon Rebel, like all SLR's, has that rapid fire mode where you can take pictures in quick succession. Putting them together looks like a movie. My Leica camera can't do that. I wish somebody could invent a camera that does both: It's small enough to fit in your pocket like the Leica and yet can do rapid fire shooting. That would be the ideal camera to own.by Linda Cargill, author of Key to Lawrence

Reviews.Title: Suprise - you need a separate memory card to use the camera
Reviews.Author: William J. Clark
Reviews.Content: Have not yet used the camera yet but was astounded and a bit irritated when I could not use it straight from the box.  It apparently has no internal memory and requires a  memory card that has to be purchased separately.  This should be plainly noted so that buyers are aware of this up front.

Reviews.Title: just like my point and shoot better
Reviews.Author: Debbie
Reviews.Content: I took a photo class... heard this was a great camera, but not for me.  Just like a point and shoot Nikon better.

Reviews.Title: I've had it for less than a year, nothing but problems!
Reviews.Author: Brooklyn newlywed
Reviews.Content: I am new to the world of DSLRs, and based on the good reviews my husband got me this camera, new, last year for Christmas.  Since it was so expensive I've treated it extremely gently.  It worked great for around 4 months.  After that, the motor on the lens stopped working -- no more photographs -- and needed repair.  5 months later, the hole for the remote switch lost sensitivity or something -- no more remote switch.  I've been meaning to get it repaired, but then this morning the camera stopped shooting.  Literally, you turn it on and nothing (the batteries are fully charged).  I hate this camera!  Don't buy it -- buy a Nikon instead, I wish I had!

Reviews.Title: Why does the headline say 18mp and the description say 12mp
Reviews.Author: MP

Reviews.Author: miamero
Reviews.Content: good good goodBe detailed and specific. What would you have wanted to know before you purchased the product?Not too short and not too long. Aim for between 75 and 300 words.

Reviews.Title: Dead after a week
Reviews.Author: C. Henry
Reviews.Content: I'm very sad to say that after only a week, the camera stopped working altogether. The battery is charged, the card is good, everything is okay, but there is no response from the camera when the battery is inserted and the camera is turned on.Very disappointing as the camera was AWESOME before it shut down.I'm RMAing it and hope that the next one is as good as it should be.

Reviews.Author: Mr. Juan
Reviews.Content: This item arrived on time and in a good conditions, unfortunately its not what I wanted, i did the mistake myself, but its OK now we are using if for the magazine and its giving us good and nice quality pics.Thanks..

Reviews.Title: For my first SLR....
Reviews.Author: Kevin Brase
Reviews.Content: I'm looking for my first SLR camera....having used a pretty decent point-and-shoot for a while now. I'm still learning but I have been getting more and more comfortable using the manual settings. I'm close to getting a T3...for the $100 or $125 is the T3 a better camera than the XS? Or....if someone has other suggestions I'm listening....thanks!

Reviews.Title: Cannot give a proper rating
Reviews.Author: Sharon Monroe
Reviews.Content: I have not been able to use the camera to tell what it is like so I cannot rate it properly. I am learning it and do not know if it is what I would like all the time. It feels good in my hand, it is light so that is a plus, but performance wise I have not yet been able to do with it what I want. Maybe a later request in a month will let me know if this is the camera for me premanantly. The service when ordering was prompt and I was pleased with that.

Reviews.Title: Nice camera.
Reviews.Author: K. Yi
Reviews.Content: Good Photograhy is about photographer (80%), lens(15%) and the body(5%).  Entry level priced camera in the hand of capable photographers produces some art forms, just unreal what people can do with a right equipment, as clearly demonstrated by viewing customer's upoladed image.Can't go wrong with Canon brand, with so many differnt high quality lens offering, and it's highly claimed customer service dept.  12 mega pixel sized sensor is just about the right size for any non-professional.  I'd like to see Canon to offer a full frame body with lesser pixel count with less complicated electronics, priced at $1000 price tag, and it may be digital rebel all over again.  I tested with 24-70mm lens, does exceed my expectation even at high ISO setting.  Canon does not offer verticle grip, as this body is little uncomfortble holding it for few hours.

Reviews.Title: Hard to take pictures with.
Reviews.Author: Feejo
Reviews.Content: I am new to DSLR, but I had a hard time to take pictures on automatic, unbelievable. Most time I press the button, no pictures showed. I discover I have to hold half way the button, wait for the beep, then press all the way down. Then if the subject is still it's ok, but to take picture of kids, good luck. When I press half way it adjust the focus, niii niii I ear all the time, anoying then it take the picture. That was all inside pictures. The body feel cheap plastic. The lens cap is cheap and hard to remove and put back on.When I put back the cap, the zoom move. I guess it's all normal, but I first tryed a Nikon. So I did not feel as good with the T3 than with the Nikon D3100. The Nikon feel alot better. The zoom on the T3 is really slack and faster to adjust. The D3100 is more firm. The focus wheel is tougher to adjust on the T3. All the menu system on the D3100 is alot easier. It have a build-in manual to explain the basic use. The T3 dose not have that. The shutter button on the T3 is small and dose not feel good to press, and your finger goes into cut plastic. The D3100 is much more confortable to use, it got pads all over the place, not the T3. When you want to reacod video with the T3, you have to turn a wheel on the top, the D3100 you just press the record button. I did not like my experience with the T3, it's cheaper and I understand why now.

Reviews.Title: A Canon disaster
Reviews.Author: Vincent M Monnier
Reviews.Content: I had to return this camera.I expected to receive a handy, easy to use camera that I could take with me on trips around the world.Instead I received a heavy, bulky camera with a huge objective and no incorporated flash.Also it came without memory card.Overall it felt like an end-of-the line, outdated technology  that Canon was selling at discounted price to get rid of their inventory.Vincent.

I’m really upsetThe item is not the same what it is offering in the photo and the characteristics are not the sameI’m not the first who says something like from this seller.It must be sanctioned.I wouldn't recommend this product even this seller to anyone else

Reviews.Title: Horrible packaging for delicate equipment
Reviews.Author: tomv
Reviews.Content: The camera just arrived yesterday. It was delivered on the day it was promised, which is great. What is not great, however, is the packaging Amazon shipped it in. $800 worth of delicate camera equipment just stuffed into a box with no cushioning to take up the air space, leaving the camera and lens free to bang around in the box? REALLY AMAZON? Even DVDs have "air bags" in the shipping container to keep them from bouncing around, and UPS is famous for tossing boxes.Usually Amazon is great about their packaging, so someone in the warehouse was just being lazy that day, and it happened to be on my package.I have not yet tried the camera to see if the optics got messed up, but will as soon as the battery pack charges.EDIT 08/03/2012People who are upset at my review apparently forgot to read the last sentence of it, which read "I have not yet tried the camera to see if the optics got messed up, but will as soon as the battery pack charges."Clearly, the review was a preliminary and a warning to others buying the camera that the poor packaging by Amazon may have a negative impact on the actual product.Thankfully, Amazon's sloppy packaging has not affected the camera, as I have since used it extensively during a couple of recent trips. This says a lot, I think, for Canon's original packaging of both the camera and the lens, as it somehow managed to survive the abuse of both Amazon and UPS.As other reviewers have noted, the instruction manual is a bit confusing, so I've barely scratched the surface of the camera's capabilities, and at the suggestion of another user, I also purchased a Delkin DDSPROC1100D-B Snug-It Pro DSLR Camera Skin for Canon Rebel T3 Black for the camera, as it is not dust proof or waterproof. This is something that purchasers should be aware of, as dust getting into the camera may not affect the final picture, but it will have a negative affect on your ability to see through the viewfinder--something I experienced first hand with a 35mm Pentax SLR I had years ago.i have taken some great pictures with this camera, both with a flash and with available lighting. The stabilizer feature did a remarkable job in keeping sharp focus while using a Canon EF-S 55-250mm f/4.0-5.6 IS II Telephoto Zoom Lens for Canon Digital SLR Cameras shooting with available light in a dense forest, giving clear, crisp resolution. Also recommended is the addition of a memory card, the bigger the better. Nothing worse than getting an "out of memory" error. I included a SanDisk Ultra 64 GB SDXC Class 10 30MB/s (SDSDU-064G-U46) with my order.I did encounter some problems downloading photos to my laptop using iPhoto, which seemed to choke and skip random photos (a problem I blame on Apple's software, not the camera), so using the "EOS Utility" provided with the camera instead of iPhoto is recommended.I bought this camera on the recommendation of a photographer friend, and I'm glad i did.

Reviews.Title: Pointless but retro
Reviews.Author: Keith Carberry
Reviews.Content: I love the style, super retro, but it can't get instagram so basically it's useless. No filters, no twitter, and way bigger than my phone. Don't get it. Prime shelf material, wouldn't ever use.

Reviews.Author: Jin
Reviews.Content: The camera is very good. It takes good pics. However, I got a defective len. There a spot on it.

Reviews.Title: Returned it. too heavy
Reviews.Author: COG
Reviews.Content: I could not hold it up with one hand with the lense fastened and didn't want a picture of my feet.

Reviews.Title: difficult to use
Reviews.Author: pete "etep"
Reviews.Content: The instruction book is very hard to read. Print is very small.  Camera is hard to use.  I wish I could return it.  I've had it for several weeks.Canon EOS Revel T3

Reviews.Title: Canon EOS Rebel T3 12.1mp
Reviews.Author: Janice L. Partin
Reviews.Content: Purchased to 'try out' a Canon DSLR. And I obviously need to go higher $$.  I've owned Nikon for past 10 years (DSLR).  Had film Canon point and shoot a long while ago.  My review isn't too great for this DSLR I'm reviewing.  It feels so light weight; and sounds like a toy camera when you shoot a photo. The photo results for the camera was fine.  The lens it came with is just a minimal use starter lens.  I'm sure it's a great camera, but was not for me.  Maybe I'll spend more; I'm sure I'll get more.  Isn't that how it goes?
